Job_Title: Cargo - STN SIN Cargo Duty Manager
Job_Descriptions: Job Description The successful candidate will be part of SIA's Cargo Division, Cargo Hub Operations & ULD Management. Key Responsibilities: •  Overall in-charge of the shift and decision maker for Cargo/Mail STN SIN during the shift. •  Supervise and monitor disruption and cargo operations ex SIN that all operating processes are in accordance with airline requirements and company procedures. •  Monitor Hub GHA performance and ensure that GHA meets all Service Level Agreements (SLA). •  Manage operational issues related to ex SIN cargo including PLACI, ACI, Custom EDI etc to ensure submission within appropriate timelines. •  Monitor ex SIN shipments to ensure uplift and in the even of offloads, to follow up with the necessary action to include rebooking is done, SIN Sales informed, service recovery commenced and offload reason noted, including Parxl. • Plan and deploy staff, equipment and other resources effectively to meet operational needs. •   Liase with GHA staff on flight handling consisting of export, import, ECC, Coolport and E-Hub operations. •  Ensure GHA staff handle special cargoes such as Dangerous Goods, Perishable, Vulnerable as well as sensitive shipments (e.g. HUM, DIP), according to SIA’s handling procedures. •  Educate staff on ways to avoid damaging cargo and not to re-use unserviceable, damaged or soiled AULDs. •   Ensure all the staff follow-up on all ex SIN irregularities reported. •   Coordinate all activities pertaining to charter operations ex SIN. •  Perform loadsheet/loadmaster duties at overseas stations when required. •  Monitor DHLE freighter programme as per the ATA ensuring SLAs and KPIs are met and to coordinate where necessary with stakeholders in  the event of disruptions. •   Manage STN SIN ULD requirements. Requirements •  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent from a recognized university •  Safety and operations focused and service-oriented. • Preferably with cargo operations / weight & balance experience / customer handling experience. •  Posses system knowledge and IT skills e.g. MS Words, Excel, RX etc. •  Preferably with driving license. •  Strong communication, analytical and inter-personal skills.

Job_Title: Debit Card & Digital Wallets Head, Asia GWM
Job_Descriptions: The Debit Cards & Digital Wallets Head is a senior management level position responsible for the development of product plans, strategies, and tactics for Global Wealth Management in Asia. The overall objective of this role is to drive Gross Dollar Volume, Fee Revenue and to deepen client relations via meaningful value propositions connected to the Debit Card and Tokenized Wallets products/features. Responsibilities: Debit Card Product Drive and implement the debit card product strategy (across both value proposition and revenue opportunities) across GWM markets in Asia (coveting all segments from Citibanking to Citi Private Bank). Market & competition benchmarking to draw up the next phase of critical enhancements needed in each market. Grow current gross dollar volume (Asia GWM) of $1.3B, $5MM interchange fee revenue and $2Bn of low-cost current account funding, by enhancing the value proposition of the product, building new payment flows and building meaningful partnerships. Act as a champion and role model for innovation and change by developing a product roadmap and executing against this roadmap with technology and country teams to ensure Citi Debit cards take a world class position. Ensure requisite prioritization and execution of in-flight workstreams including legacy markets. Continue to provide central oversight and support on all local and regional governance linked deliverables and initiatives as needed. Develop an executable framework for driving usage and spend growth encompassing strategic and tactical initiatives across merchant categories, payment methods and key calendar events. Manage Network relationships (MasterCard, Visa) across markets. Optimum utilization of funding received via Debit Development Fund ($7-10MM per year), Support Fund and Strategic Initiatives Fund. Form a deep understanding of the merchant-based payment trends in the industry with a focus on the role of debit cards, customer behavior, latest technology, key players and disruptors. Explore opportunities with Mastercard and Visa to develop and execute relevant, new payment capabilities as consumer behavior and technology trends change, such as the development of payments tokenization, card-to-card payments and digital wallets (Credit & Debit). Partner with the Citi Global Wallet product proposition to a leading, best-in-class positioning in the region and be seen as the benchmark solution for clients, competitors and the industry. Collaborate with other product/segments teams to introduce innovative new propositions that leverage multiple product capabilities to drive strategic initiatives to grow interest and fee revenue. Strategic Partnerships Lead and develop the pipeline and execution of strategic partnerships for banking products across the region with co-operations from different industries (Fintechs, Airlines, e-commerce partners etc.) to expand Citi’s reach and distribution. Define optimal models and economic feasibility for partnerships across distribution, co-brands and private/white label arrangements as a key to growing the retail banking business and providing a pipeline for wealth management services. Take a leading role working with country counterparts to cover the end-to-end cycle of partnerships including pitch, negotiation, partner management and ongoing support. Form a deep understanding of partnership models and trends in the industry with a focus on the role of transactional banking (FX, deposits, and debit cards) to capture opportunities on customer behavior, latest technology, key players and disruptors. Qualifications: 10+ years of relevant experience Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Marketing, specialized analytics or related discipline Broad and diverse function experience in marketing, acquisitions, product development and analytics Ability to work under pressure and manage deadlines or unexpected changes in expectations or requirements Demonstrated analytical skills Demonstrated problem-solving and decision-making skills Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication Ability to work in a team-oriented environment Education: Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience Master’s degree preferred ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Product Management and Development ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: Product Management ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Job_Title: Commercial Banking Trade Sales Head, APAC
Job_Descriptions: This role will head the Sales efforts for Trade for Citi Commercial Bank (CCB) Client segment across Asia Pacific. They will establish a sales and origination model that drives trade growth including structured trade deals, identify synergies between Commercial Banking its ecosystem clients within the Large Corporate Group. Supporting new client acquisition in Citi’s CCB franchise markets in Asia will be a critical responsibility of this role. The role will also run with strategic initiatives and determine focus industry segments and trade corridors most compatible for trade portfolio expansion. The role requires close engagement with the trade product team, CCB country sales teams and clients to build a sustainable and market winning portfolio. Key Responsibilities: The role will involve the following: Meeting targeted trade wins and revenue growth for Citi Commercial Banking (CCB) clients across Asia. Implement and lead execution of sales campaign by country/product to improve market share and client penetration. Working with trade partners across the globe to expand and grow cross-regional Trade for Asian clients. Managing and building the Specialized Solution Sales team to expand trade specific origination across the region. Partnering with the Commercial Bank Relationship Managers to grow and expand the Trade wallet of existing clients as well as a focused new client acquisition strategy. Working closely with the Country TTS Heads and Country Trade teams to enhance their understanding of Trade products across the TTS Sales teams and leverage their network for greater origination. Developing a strong working relationship with CCB client coverage seniors, industry specialists and risk seniors in the region. Coaching and mentoring the specialized trade sales team to up-tier their sales, structuring and credit skills. Providing support and direction into "winning" the most complex and profitable transactions. Fostering a strong "one team" mentality across various Trade product & sales teams and CCB teams to maximize collaboration, cross-sell & build team spirit in APAC across a broad and culturally diverse team. Building a strong partnership with the Trade Implementation and Operations teams and constantly seeking ways to improve Trade efficiency, turnaround times and ensuring we minimize operational losses/errors. Building strong partnership with the trade risk distribution to help Trade effectively manage its balance sheet, individual credit exposures and increase skim revenues. Focus on commercializing digitized trade offerings. Contributing to global Trade being No.1 in League Tables and improving Trade APAC's results in league tables and general market presence. Build and develop the reputation of Citi Trade externally through thought leadership, client events both internal and external, and media recognition. Work in close partnership with control functions such as Legal, Compliance, Market and Credit Risk, Audit, Finance in order to ensure appropriate governance and control infrastructure Build a culture of responsible finance, good governance and supervision, expense discipline and ethics Development Value: Part of a high performing Asia Trade management team responsible for delivering against aggressive growth targets. Experience gained from managing a broad and complex set of Trade products. Experience gained from managing a large and geographically/culturally diversified team. Managing a large P&L business. Broad regional business exposure. Knowledge/Experience: Extensive Trade experience. Proven track-record of team, people and business management skills. Strong credit skills and experience, including broad knowledge of Citigroup credit processes. Broad commercial banking client management experience. Skills: Excellent communication and written skills. Superior organizational skills (including self-organizational skills). Superior strategic and analytical skills. Superior client management & deal negotiation skills. Ability to interact at all levels of senior management. Competencies: Exceptional process management ability. Good people leadership skills. Able to motivate/influence. Superior interpretive and problem-solving skills. Excellent team working and outstanding interpersonal skills. Ability to operate in a complex matrix environment. Valuing Diversity: Demonstrates an appreciation of a diverse workforce. Appreciates differences in style or perspective and uses differences to add value to decisions or actions and organizational success. Partnership, horizontal collaboration Qualifications: Degree or equivalent preferred. Exceptional candidates who do not meet these criteria may be considered for the role, provided they have the necessary skills and experience. ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Product Management and Development ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: Product Performance Management ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Job Description The successful candidate will be part of SIA's Cargo Division, Cargo Hub Operations & ULD Management. Key Responsibilities: •  Overall in-charge of the shift and decision maker for Cargo Hub Operations during the shift. •  Supervise and monitor aircraft rotation, disruption and cargo operations so that all operating processes are in accordance with airline requirements and company procedures. •  Manage and track freighter aircraft movements system-wide. Follow up with down line stations to ensure adequate resources in an event of late inbound arrival (>1.5 hours) into their stations. • Follow up with SIA OCC on flight cancellations, re-routing, re-scheduling and flight diversion. • Approve flight delays due commercial, operational, technical and other related issues (e.g. Crew, FTL, Airport/Airspace closure/curfew). • Monitor charters, extra flight services or relief flights. • Follow up with stations to submit Delay Occurrence Report (DOR) promptly in the event of a flight delay. DMs must query stations if they do not explain the cause of the delay properly. • Liaise with the respective Head Office departments (e.g. Space Management, Commercial Planning, Engineering, and Flight Ops) on follow up actions in the event of aircraft on ground. • Manage Freighter related crisis until the Crisis Management Centre (CMC) is set up. Liaise with SIA OCC to ensure all concerned parties are informed of the incident. This includes the activation of the Cargo Functional Group internal recall list of persons for Crisis Management System (CMS) data entry and other duties as required by the Manager Cargo Analysis (CMC Appointment Holder). • Monitor Hub GHA performance and ensure that GHA meets all Service Level Agreements (SLA). • Plan and deploy staff, equipment and other resources effectively to meet operational needs. • Liaise with GHA staff on flight handling consisting of export, import , ECC, Coolport, and E-Hub operations. • Ensure GHA staff handle special cargoes such as Dangerous Goods, Perishable, Vulnerable as well as sensitive shipments (e.g. HUM, DIP), according to SIA’s handling procedures. • Educate staff on ways to avoid damaging cargo and not to re-use unserviceable, damaged or soiled AULDs. • Ensure that staff follow-up on all irregularities reported. • Coordinate all activities pertaining to charter operations. • Perform loadsheet/loadmaster duties at overseas stations when required. Requirements •  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent from a recognized university •  Safety and operations focused and service-oriented. • Preferably with cargo operations / weight & balance experience / customer handling experience. •  Posses system knowledge and IT skills e.g. MS Words, Excel, RX etc. •  Preferably with driving license. •  Strong communication, analytical and inter-personal skills.

Job_Title: Citi Private Bank - Investment Finance Analyst
Job_Descriptions: Job Responsibilities: As an Investment Finance (IF) Analyst, the primary responsibility is to engage stakeholders such as IF Specialist/Transactors, Associate Bankers/Bankers, Risk Managers, Credit Controllers and Technology Business Analyst in the daily course of work. The candidate is also expected to be proficient in the end-to-end processing of simplified credits by liaising with all the above stake-holders to discuss and subsequently set up credit facilities on CPB platform via: Ensuring credit needs of client are captured and recommended accordingly in Credit Approval Ensuring documentation, suitability, KYC, credit risk, Citi policy and Regulatory requirements are considered and compiled with in the approval process Ensuring credit details are accurately and timely inputted in to various systems and circulated for approval Working closely with credit controllers to complete systemic setup Other responsibilities include: Maintenance of Credit Approval due to changes in limits, re-allocation of limits, cancellation of limits and other aspect of credit details changes Ensuring continual compliance with Citi Credit Policy/Regulations/Product Programs such as reviewing portfolio collateral concentration, liquidity and limit excess Leading, coordinating and participating in Strategic/Adhoc projects, system enhancements, Compliance review, Internal Audit, MCA and the likes. Development Opportunities of the Role: Prepares candidate for progression opportunities such as IF Specialist or Risk Management Officer Gains understanding of CPB Credit Policies and Credit Product Programs Gains understanding of collateral valuation and monitoring processes Gains understanding of documentation requirements for different types of credit facilities Builds knowledge of capital market products and derivatives and margin requirements Participate in structuring complex credit, together with IF Transactor and Specialist, for CPB Platinum clients. Compliance Responsibilities: High degree of client’s information confidentiality Comply with the ethical standards contained in the Citigroup Code of Conduct Ensure that the business unit adheres to firm policies and procedures, regulatory and legislative requirements Qualifications: A good university degree at a minimum. Knowledge of Finance and Accounting will be an advantage Up to 5 years of working experience, preferably in a financial institution Key Competencies / Skills: Technical/Specialist skills/competencies: Good understanding of financial statements and accounting standards; Understanding of legal systems and documentation Business/Industry knowledge/competencies Understanding of CPB Credit Policies and Credit Product Program Understanding collateral valuation Familiarity with Bloomberg terminals Knowledge of Capital Markets instruments and characteristics Risk management skills Personal Attributes/Interpersonal skills: Ability to work both in a team environment and autonomously Result oriented individual who is able to work against tight deadlines, and willing to put in long hours when required Ability to exercise independent thinking, balanced judgment and participate in constructive debates Strong written and oral communication skills ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Private Client Product Services ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: IF Lending Generalist ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. The Senior Engineering lead APAC will act as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) with end-to-end responsibility for HAVC/MEP engineering on assigned Capex projects in Asia Pacific region, with personal development potential to higher management level. She/He should be aspired and passionate in ensuring a safe, reliable, and sustainable technology solutions is in place for Bayer’s Life Science Businesses. YOUR TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Oversee HVAC/MEP system throughout entire project Lifecyle (concept planning, engineering, field installation, commissioning, and qualification upon ready-for-production) on assigned Capex projects in Asia Pacific region Manages and coordinates engineering with external engineering partner and HVAC/MEP suppliers Manage, execute, or review of HVAC design criteria, drawings and BoQ, cGMP specialties HVAC system –Pressure cascades, local protection areas for processing, consideration in dealing with hazardous substances. Determination of the commissioning and qualification strategy of the considered plants including the preparation of the documents for C&Q (e.g.DQ document) Manage, execute, or review of HVAC zoning and schematic diagram, Layout drawings, BMS/EMS Control strategy, HVAC calculation, Air flow simulations and related cGMP facility C&Q activities Responsibilities include Support + Participation in Safety-Reviews/Quality review in project phase gates End-to-end responsibility to ensure proper HVAC/MEP system set-up quality in compliance with international good engineering practice and manufacturing excellence, accepted schedule and economic efficient Collaborate across team/-functions internally and externally to deliver optimal Capex project business goals Primary contact-point as subject matter experts (SME) for HVAC/MEP system , to support selected strategic manufacturing sites operation in Asia Pacific region. WHO YOU ARE: Minimum a Bachelors Degree/ Masters Degree (added advantage) in Mechanical or HVAC related engineering or equivalent More than 10 years’ experience in life science ( cGMP manufacturing and chemical formulation-filling-packing ) manufacturing facility set-up. Track-record on HVAC/MEP delivery both on engineering and field supervision management (IO/OQ/PQ execution, eg air/-water balancing, room air exchange rate and pressure cascades balancing , HEPA filter integrity test) within regional or international project environment BMS/BAS/EMS system, firefighting system knowledge and Manufacturing facility (eg. Cell & Gene Therapy/ATMP, Modular, Continuous process) set-up knowledge is a added advantage Good interpersonal skills on communication, listening, verbal and assertiveness Empower for Inclusion and Diversity, learning agility and passion for digitalization and technology trends Ability to work in different geographic locations Willingness to execute projects at remote locations under travel or project assignment across Asia Pacific region.

Job_Title: Regional Marketing Manager, Digital Solutions APAC
Job_Descriptions: The Regional Marketing Manager, Digital Solutions APAC is responsible to define the regional Digital Solutions Business marketing strategy and own the regional brand plan, closely aligned with the global Digital Solutions Business brand plan. He/She will also coordinate regional product launch activities in close collaboration with other local and global Bayer teams and lead and integrate regional marketing initiatives (e.g., events, digital, PR) as well as go-to-market strategies in close collaboration with other local and global Bayer team. YOUR TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Lead and implement segmentation, targeting, channel and marketing mix strategy taking into consideration regional and local market as well as customer needs Lead and integrate the regional brand digital presence (e.g., SEO, PPC, E-Mail, Social, etc.) and content marketing strategy Proactively assess brand performance and marketing activities and takes follow-up, measurables actions Work closely with the Head of Digital Solutions APAC, Sales and Product Management teams to inform the product roadmap Build strong relationships and networks with customers, patients, HCPs and other key partners to design clear value propositions by in-depth knowledge and understanding of their needs WHO YOU ARE: Master’s Degree in Science/Business or equivalent Long-term work experience with successful track record within local/regional/global marketing and in the HealthCare domain Strong business acumen and experience in technology marketing (SaaS, IT or Tech Products) Experience using automation and analytics tools (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, Social, Analytics) Solid understanding of modern (digital) marketing techniques (e.g., web, SEO, PPC, E-Mail, Social, etc.) Excellent leadership, communication and inter-personal skills to lead cross-functional, multi-cultural teams Hands-on mentality, self-motivation, team-player attitude, detail-orientation and results-driven mindset Demonstrable ability to create excitement, both internally and Qualification & Competencies: externally and a positive forward-looking mindset

Job_Title: Regional VP, GEMS (Growth Emerging Markets - ASEAN and South Korea)
Job_Descriptions: About the job The Red Hat Sales team is looking for a Regional Vice-President of Growth Emerging Markets (GEMS), covering Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) and South Korea to join us in Singapore. In this role, you will serve as the primary point of contact for strategy, marketing, and direct and channel sales activities for the GEMS market, and work closely with the rest of the Asia Pacific (APAC) leadership team to promote the development of Red Hat in GEMS. You’ll serve as the key account management leader for GEMS, be the face of Red Hat in the market and assume full profit and loss (P&L) accountability. As the Regional VP, you’ll lead by example in instilling a consultative sales mindset in which Red Hat strives to engage C-suite decision makers, like CIO, CEO, CFO, in strategic business conversations, gain keen insight into their business needs, and develop Red Hat-based solutions that can address those needs. In addition, you’ll build, train, and manage a direct sales and channel sales team, and play an active role in shaping and developing new customers, partnerships, and joint ventures to achieve Red Hat’s strategy of being the leader in infrastructure and platform solutions for cloud and enterprise. You’ll report to the General Manager of APAC. What you will do Ensure that P&L targets are met or exceeded Develop and deliver longer-term strategy and make the optimal trade-offs between achieving short-term goals against making the investments required to build the foundation for future success Identify, attract, develop, and retain top talent in GEMS Build a positive team culture, including rewards and recognition that align associate’s focus with Red Hat’s company goals and values Coach and mentor the team, strengthening the effectiveness of each member Establish an effective sales management process for the team, including account planning, deal fulfillment, performance assessment, follow-up, and closing Lead cross-functional teams as part of an integrated go-to-market approach for GEMS Work closely with the APAC Functional Leaders, like Enterprise, Commercial, Telco, Eco System, Customer Success, to develop a holistic sales, marketing, and services strategy for the region, including value-selling, bundled sales, and up-selling Instill solid discipline and manage and report on projected targets, forecasts, and team results Engage executive leadership in creative solutions for increasing maximum revenue Manage key customer relationships and advocate for the GEMS customer market within Red Hat Be an open source champion within key customer relationships and help make them be successful with long-term engagements, optimizing their strategic relationship with Red Hat Be a solution building champion, as a coach and mentor to the sales teams, in solving customer problems with the wide array of products and services in the Red Hat portfolio and partner ecosystem Embody and promote the Red Hat brand in the local markets with customers, analysts, media representatives, and more Embody Red Hat’s values of freedom, courage, commitment, and accountability Build a sense of community where customers and associates feel strongly connected to the mission and value of open innovation What you will bring 5+ years of GM or 10+ years of VP-level direct, indirect sales, or joint venture experience in enterprise technology, e.g., infrastructure software, including operating systems, security, cloud-enablement, information management, middleware IT services, including BPO, system integration, application development 5+ years of experience in an multinational corporate environment Success in implementing short and long-term focused strategies to grow revenue within a region Record of ownership over personal and team revenue targets, forecasting sales accurately, and identifying critical sales pipeline indicators Experience working in a global technology company, with a record of contributing to the broader region's business success Ability to surpass goals and seize opportunities to push the envelope Record of continually setting higher goals that are ambitious and realistic for yourself and team in line with organization objects Focus on new business opportunities that enable business development targets to be exceeded. Ability to delegate thoughtfully to free yourself to work on a strategic level Willingness to collaborate and openly debate on managing projects, solving problems, discussing challenging issues, and learn more about critical issues as a team Record of collaboration to establish clear and challenging performance goals and metrics for the year Ability to think 2-3 years ahead and make the right investments and change direction as needed Ability to explain how changes in Red Hat’s competitors, customers, and market segments affect business Experience translating broad corporate strategies into clear, specific objectives, and plans for teams and individuals Ability to influence others, motivated with a sense of humility Solid work ethic and impeccable integrity Ability and desire to engage with others within the Sales and Marketing organizations and across the company About Red Hat Red Hat is the world’s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux, hybrid cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications, develop cloud-native applications, standardize on our industry-leading operating system, and automate, secure, and manage complex environments. Award-winning support, training, and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers, system integrators, application vendors, customers, and open source communities, Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future. Red Hat’s culture is built on the open source principles of transparency, collaboration, and inclusion, where the best ideas can come from anywhere and anyone. When this is realized, it empowers people from diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences to come together to share ideas, challenge the status quo, and drive innovation. Our aspiration is that everyone experiences this culture with equal opportunity and access, and that all voices are not only heard but also celebrated. We hope you will join our celebration, and we welcome and encourage applicants from all the beautiful dimensions of diversity that compose our global village. Read our complete Statement of Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative. Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020. Responsibilities Analyse and draw out rich insights from large sets of data from multiple sources (e.g. Google Analytics, Enterprise Data Warehouse, ContentSquare, Qualtrics or 3rd-party sources) in order to develop key insights for the business Present findings and insights using Excel / Powerpoint / Tableau / other visualization tools to the Product Owners, Designers, Partners and Management to help make data-driven decisions Collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand business problems and recommend relevant actions that provide meaningful results to the business function e.g. competitor analysis, market share and acquisition drivers, identifying new growth opportunities. Provide analytical horsepower to shape business strategy and provide analytical steering for the business e.g. market forecasting, opportunity sizing, customer base profiling, customer segmentation, business casing. Work with the business to create self-help performance dashboards for recurring metrics to drive incremental growth. Provide analytical support during the weekly, monthly and quarterly business performance reviews and forecasts. Drive and deliver new data capabilities through ingestion of relevant datasets (with support of IT) and building foundational data structures to support reporting, analysis, and combination with other telco data sources Ensure compliance to data governance as well as data integrity Requirement Bachelor preferably in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics Related quantitative field with min. 3 years of relevant work experience in business analysis for digital data Excellent problem solving, analytical skills and business acumen Ability to collect and organize data, analyze and formulate insights Ability to tell compelling, data-driven stories or insights based on large, complex data sets Ability to create polished data driven presentations for executive and board-level consumption Hands-on experience with Google Analytics, SQL, VBA Experience writing SQL/SAS queries and pulling data from enterprise data warehouse Good to have hands-on experience in building dashboards with Tableau. Good to have Telco or Marketing experience

Job_Title: Ops Support Executive, EUC & Svc Desk
Job_Descriptions: NCS is a leading technology services firm with presence in Asia Pacific and partners with governments and enterprises to advance communities through technology. Combining the experience and expertise of its 10,000-strong team across 49 specialisations, NCS provides differentiated and end-to-end technology services to clients with its NEXT capabilities of digital, cloud, platforms as well as core offerings in application, infrastructure, engineering and cyber security. NCS also believes in building a strong partner eco-system with leading technology players, research institutions and start-ups to support open innovation and co-creation. For more information, visit ncs.co. We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for our employees & customers and will require all prospective employees to be fully vaccinated. As an Infra Engineer, the broad area of your job responsibilities will cover the following: Perform End User Support – Client Management Perform troubleshooting for client platform related problems. Respond promptly to incident, investigate & provide temporary &/or permanent resolution of incidents escalated. Provide timely status updates to relevant parties. Perform service request related to client platforms. Monitor the agreed service level, document & maintain the configuration of the systems; provide regular reporting to relevant parties. Involve in client platform implementation/upgrade project. Perform follow-up with vendor on replacement of hardware. Perform asset management & update asset records. Perform user account management (eg. Create password, reset & delete) Perform local server administration to facilitate software distribution & patch management service. Manage client platform implementation / upgrade project. Ensure deliverables meet service level requirement. Propose and implement action plan when required. Established facility management standards/best practices to ensure operation consistency across project / facility management teams. Submit progress reports Ideal candidate should possess the following: Candidate with minimum Higher Nitec, Diploma Certification in Computer/Electronic Engineering or equivalent discipline Preferably with 1 or more years related experience in Technology Administration. Some network knowledge will be an advantage Computer literacy in MS Office Proficiency in Technology will be added advantage Independent, resourceful, result-oriented individuals with a "can-do" attitude

Job_Title: Trans Capture Lead Analyst - C13 - Trading Middle Office
Job_Descriptions: The Trans Capture Lead Analyst is a senior level position responsible for providing complex analytic and administrative support to traders as the subject matter expert, in coordination with the Transaction Capture team. The overall objective of this role is to solve complex client queries, conduct due diligence activities, and advise or coach new or junior staff. Responsibilities: Provide analytic / administrative support to Front Office Sales and Trading on derivatives and securities transactions Support trade capture management, Front to Back reconciliation, operational risk identification, trade confirmation and settlement forecasts Develop and implement business initiatives, client solutions, and/or projects on pre-settlement processes and transaction capture activities Ensure the volume, quality, timeliness and delivery of complex deliverables, and the integrity of processes, operations and associated results Solve complex client queries, conducting due diligence activities and providing detailed analysis of issues Develop and execute plans, policies and procedures, and assist with leading projects; offering solutions and cost saving opportunities Oversee daily performance, contribute to standards, and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Service Level Agreements (SLAs) Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 6-10 years of experience in a related role Significant industry experience required Subject matter expertise in multiple or specific skill sets, business areas or Markets products Strong Trading Middle office experience Demonstrated analytical and process execution skills Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication Demonstrated ability to remain unbiased in a diverse working environment Education: Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience Master’s degree preferred ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Operations - Transaction Services ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: Transaction Capture Services ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Company Description You’re talented and adaptable. That’s why you’ll fit in. As well as discovering, mining and processing many of the essential raw materials that enable, support and enhance modern life, our global business is involved in selling and marketing products – copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore, coal, nickel and diamonds. Through our Marketing Business, we are able to offer innovative solutions to meet our customers’ specific challenges. This includes physical products, logistics and technical support, as well as pricing and financing solutions. Job Description What you’ll do The Product Owner will join the Transformational Moves team in Digital & Innovation and be responsible for the analysis, selection, and delivery of a portfolio of Trade Digitalisation initiatives. Initiatives to digitalise traditionally very paper-based trade, finance, shipping and operations processes include blockchain enabled platforms as well as industry wide standardisation efforts. The Product Owner will work across the Marketing BU, our Commodity Marketing Teams and technology teams as well as external partners and customers. The role will require working closely with the Front Office, Sales & Operations, Shipping, legal, regulatory and communications teams as well as the Digital & Innovation and other technology teams and stakeholders. Support the rollout of new ways of working to commodity marketing teams and functions, to enable innovation and agile delivery and develop the digital community within the Marketing BU. Customer Needs Working with customers, internal stakeholders and external partners to understand the commodity specific trading, finance, shipping and logistics processes and functional requirements Design-led thinking and the ability to explain the value of this to internal and external stakeholders Implement and further develop solutions with customers, internal stakeholders and vendors through demos, design sprints, ideation sessions etc. Through a deep understanding of business requirements, ensure the solution meets the functional requirements of the business Data-driven decision making at high and low-levels Product Vision Able to balance cost, delivery timelines, and product capabilities to rapidly implement or develop a MVP Have a strong sense of the product to-be (backed up by data), but be driven to collaborate and happy to shift perspectives as the product iterates Ability to appreciate industry-specific norms and expectations (e.g. relatively low maturity of digital products) and to bake these into how the product will evolve Industry, customer and competitor research. Explore trade, finance, shipping and logistics solutions and trends to shape the Trade Digitalisation strategy and roadmap for Marketing. Good understanding of blockchain and other emerging technologies and how these may enhance the solution Monitor evolving blockchain opportunities such as decentralised exchanges (DEX), tokenisation of physical assets and the regulatory landscape in Singapore and other jurisdictions. Lead small, agile teams and collaborate closely with Commodity Marketing Front Office and Sales & Operations teams, Shipping and the wider Digital & Innovation team Responsible for product delivery (driving technical development, responsible for (leading) agile ceremonies and their outputs, lightweight, agile reporting against cost/timelines etc.) Actively promote and embed digital, innovative and agile skillsets within Marketing Feature prioritisation and the delivery of incremental value Work with IM and other support teams to manage the full integration and digitalisation of e.g. electronic Letters of Credit (eLC) or Bills of Lading (eBL) Confident in challenging and interrogating product/business analysis and technical implementation. Happy to act as the Voice of the Customer in product testing (QA, UAT) Able and willing to champion the product internally and externally Leverage learnings from across commodity marketing teams and functions• Ensure that solutions are aligned to group standards (including Anglo American Security and Operating Standards) The creation and maintenance of delivery dashboards/analytics and the product roadmap Stakeholder engagement and management Maintain relationships with key internal and external partners including Commodity Marketing Teams, Marketing BU functions and Marketing Information Management (IM) team Drive active stakeholder engagement to align on the best practice concepts and solutions, and to make sure that the future trends and risks are considered and mitigated. Qualifications What we’re looking for Undergraduate or Masters degree in Business, Economics or Technical area 5+ years of agile Project Management and Digital Product Design Domain knowledge of commodities covering trading, trade finance, shipping and operations Blockchain experience and good understanding of digital technologies and data science Digital Product Design experience using design-led and data-driven practices to develop and implement digital solutions and products Strong functional knowledge of digital architectures, systems, technologies, and platforms Experience managing stakeholders of various levels Additional Information Who we are Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine, process, move and market our products to our customers around the world. As a responsible miner – of diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore, coal and nickel – we are the custodians of what are precious natural resources. We work together with our key partners and stakeholders to unlock the sustainable value that those resources represent for our shareholders, the communities and countries in which we operate and for society at large. Anglo American is re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives. What we offer Competitive salary and benefits package Amazing opportunities for learning and growth - from technical training to leadership programs, we bring out the best in our people We’re a large, successful multinational company and there are plenty of opportunities internally to move onwards and upwards too Inclusion and Diversity Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential. Covid Vaccination Intent Since safe and effective COVID-19 vaccines have become widely available this year, we have strongly encouraged employees to get vaccinated at the earliest possible opportunity. However, as vaccines have been proven to be a very effective and safe way of protecting people and reducing Covid-19 transmission, we have now announced our intent to introduce a policy that requires Covid-19 vaccination for access to all sites and offices. This policy would apply to all new joiners to the company as well as existing employees and contractors. We are in the process of undertaking a comprehensive engagement process with all our stakeholders about our intent. This is so we can tailor our approach in each country, including ensuring what we do is lawful. Once this is complete, we will look to implement the policy. There may be differences in how and when it is implemented due to local context and legal requirements. How to apply To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process. Recommended Skills Agile Methodology Blockchain Business Analysis Business Requirements Commodity Market Communication

At Hitachi Energy our purpose is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals, and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation As a Regional Marketing & Market Analysis Specialist, you will be part of Hitachi Energy business. Primarily, your role will involve monitoring and analyzing external market trends and internal sales & marketing data to enable strategy development, strategy roll-out and performance KPI tracking. You will work in a multi-national and region-spanning team in a collaborative spirit to drive marketing activities as well as supporting the regional and local sales teams in their strategic and operational sales work through sales process improvements, sales data monitoring & visualization as well as supporting periodic sales reviews. We are open to base the role in the home country where the applicant is based right now namely: - Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, India Your responsibilities Tracking and analyzing market dynamics of regional utilities, industrial, transport, renewable segment and providing market intelligence support and guidance for business growth and positioning strategy within the region. Closely monitoring evolution of pipelines in SFDC and acting as the interface point between regional teams and the BU and GPGs for market and strategy processes such as DOE, Heatmaps, WSP, PIE Budget. Leading and coordinating Win/Loss analysis process, consolidating actions stemming from the analyses and tracking progresses to close them timely. Collecting and analyzing customers’ feedbacks, organizing “Voice-of-Customer” campaigns and performing competitor analysis for the region. Building-up regional marketing plans based on the global strategy, supporting regional promotion campaigns and customer events and releasing promotional materials focusing on regional needs. Actively providing feedbacks on market intelligence, customer value and competition move, requests on competitiveness improvement and supporting strategy implementation. Leading the coordination of internal sources of market/customer/demand information coming from Front-End Sales and Account Management. Initiate, drive and support sales process improvement and roll-outs throughout the region Coordinate annual market analysis and sales budget activities as the key window between countries and region. Coordination of regular sales reviews with focus to increase efficiency in the sales governance. Drive and develop internal communications through success stories and best-practice sharing, enable and support internal strategy communication as well as general internal engagement activities. Safety & Integrity: Living Hitachi Energy core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business. Your background A University degree in Business Management or Engineering. More than 8+ years of experience in marketing and/or selling industrial systems (ideally in grid systems) within the region of responsibility. Technical understanding of grid integration products and solutions and proven experience in customer-facing activities: sales management and/or product promotion is preferred. Strong analytical and financial skills to perform market analysis and prepare business plans and ability to synthetize complex or ambiguous issues into simple and clear statements. Excellent communication skills, both written and oral; Fluency in English and at least one other key language of the region, both written and spoken. Strong Excel and PPT skills. Good communicator to engage with diverse set of colleagues. Good presentation skills. Experience with internal communication methods is preferred. More about us Hitachi Energy is a global technology leader that is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We serve customers in the utility, industry and infrastructure sectors with innovative solutions and services across the value chain. Together with customers and partners, we pioneer technologies and enable the digital transformation required to accelerate the energy transition towards a carbon-neutral future. We are advancing the world’s energy system to become more sustainable, flexible, and secure whilst balancing social, environmental, and economic value. Hitachi Energy has a proven track record and unparalleled installed base in more than 140 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ around 38,000 people in 90 countries and generate business volumes of approximately $10 billion USD. www.hitachienergy.com Recommended Skills Account Management Advertising Analytical Business Management Communication English

You will work alongside the education team to support Singapore public schools implement iOS programs. RESPONSIBILITIES: Provide project management oversight to all PDLP schools and other designated public schools, ensuring all programs and support initiatives are delivered on time and to the highest quality. Coordinate APL consultants to deliver programs in schools, such as LWI, ILEs, VLT sessions. And you can remain calm when situations demand it. You make the complex simple and you command an audience by bringing them along for the journey. When challenged with complex questions, you share your deep knowledge of how our hardware, software and services integrate. You bring the highest level of integrity, honesty, and accountability in all that you do, every day. You are a trusted advisor who does what you say you'll do - and always does what's best for the company. Customer, partner and team relationships You see the world through the eyes of education leaders and teachers by deeply understanding their learning environments, challenges, and concerns. You obsess over how they experience our products and services. Customer and partner needs can often be unique - but, you're quick on your feet and connect and influence the right people both internal and external. You are a go-to person with leadership, and are trusted and comfortable in tough situations. You can settle disputes, negotiations and be responsible for the hard calls with minimal noise. You step up to conflicts and see them as opportunities to shine. You know how to contribute to your team. You enjoy a collaborative environment with open dialogue and debate. You empower your teammates to do their life's best work. When projects require extra support, you are eager to step up and bring your knowledge to the table. You know yourself - you have strengths, weaknesses and opportunities - but you also know the people around you and are open to their feedback. You relate well to all kinds of people - up, down, and sideways, inside and outside the organisation. When faced with a challenging opportunity, you know who to connect with and when. People know you're a real teammate and you know what it takes to win. Strategy, solutions, and results Solutions enable learning environments to be transformed in simple and innovative ways. You create high-reaching and breakthrough strategies that truly shape the future. You do this by asking why and why not, both stripping out what is not essential and identifying what is. By doing so, you are able to see what's ahead and identify trends that will be important for educational change. You strive for excellence in everything you do. Due to changing priorities, urgent customer needs, or a final push to meet a quarterly forecast, you face the daily challenge of where to focus your time and energy. You have a don't give up attitude, and finish, even when met with resistance or setbacks. You seize every opportunity and empower others to reach their goals along the way. Responsibilities As an Enterprise Architect you will be responsible for: Defining and design system architecture for multiple enterprise applications and ensures that they are integrated to aligned to project, program, and business strategies. Setting the direction and establishes the approaches for integrating and exchanging information across various enterprise applications. Engaging with C-level DXC and Client Executives to understand and propose solutions to business challenges. Cataloguing, developing, coordinating, communicating, maintaining, and enforcing the overall Enterprise Architecture Models, Representations, Initiatives, Capabilities, and Standard Components used by the organization to perform all business and technology related activities. Guiding project development teams in areas of application software design, development, testing and implementation. You are also required to work closely with solution architects, software developers, project managers and other team members to ensure successful implementation of enterprise applications. Prerequisites To be successful in this role, the candidate should have the following qualifications, skills and experience: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related discipline with at least 10+ years of experience in delivering enterprise applications and with at least 5+ years as Enterprise/Solution Architect. Proficient in/with: o Programming Languages e.g., Java, C# o Open-source Libraries and APIs e.g., Spring, Hibernate, JQuery, Angular o Application Architectures e.g., Web, Desktop, Mobile, Microservice, Cloud o Software Development Tools and Standards e.g., Coding Conventions, Best Practices, Design Patterns o Advance understanding of RDBMS such as Oracle, Oracle Golden Gate, Data Lake, DB2, mySQL etc o Software Development Methodologies e.g., Waterfall, Iterative, Agile Experienced in: o Full Software Development Lifecycles (SLDC) o Producing effort estimates and sizing based on high-level functional requirements o Software quality assurance process; setting development guidelines and performing code/design reviews o Delivering applications using Cloud Technology such as Azure, Docker, Kafka, Kubernetes, Prometuous, Splunk. O Delivering applications using Monolith Platform Technology such as UNIX, Windows, Virtualisation, Networking, Firewall, Load Balancer, Application Servers such as IBM Websphere o Leading teams across broad technical disciplines o Conducting training and mentoring teams in the areas of system architecture and software engineering o Guiding teams in addressing application security concerns o Producing documents relating to application architecture, system design, integration processes and testing procedures Possess excellent analytical, creative, problem-solving and critical thinking skills: o Able to offer viable solutions for various systems and architectures to different types of businesses o Ensure seamless integration of new and existing systems to eliminate potential problems and maintain data structure and integrity o Able to lead team in application troubleshooting and performance tuning Excellent verbal and written communication as well as interpersonal skills Good-to-have: Industry certification such as TOGAF Experience in integrating Commercial-Off-The-Shelf (COTS) products to enterprise applications Public Sector projects/program experience Rvin James Murillo Andalan EA License No.: 02C3423 Personnel Registration No.: R1331697 Please note that your response to this advertisement and communications with us pursuant to this advertisement will constitute informed consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of personal data by ManpowerGroup Singapore for the purpose of carrying out its business, in compliance with the relevant provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012. The Planner is responsible for implementing, monitoring, measuring and reporting production schedules to ensure that materials and capacities are available to meet the needs of customers. Manage planning and production execution data including work orders, prioritization, capacity constraints and production monitoring. Implement an effective and appropriate capacity management and production monitoring system. * Maintain MRP planning and scheduling parameters for "make" items. Analyze planned order reports and provide timely release of production work orders specified by the production plan. Interface with production teams and procurement specialists to prioritize items. Identify and resolve production demand and supply imbalances in volume and mix. Provide daily guidance and information to the Product Line team regarding the status of production schedules. Prepare and communicate shortage and backlog reports, and flag other potential interruptions to the Planning Manager. Monitor production progress against scheduling needs and intervene as necessary to bring deliveries back into compliance with production schedules. Identify and report opportunities and implement actions to reduce waste, shorten lead times and reduce costs. Report scheduling, capacity and production tracking data, statistics and metrics as defined by the Master Schedule policy. Use the guiding principles and the tools of the Manufacturing System to drive continuous improvement wherever applicable. Preferably in Manufacturing/Production Operations or equivalent experience. As a Security Operations Analyst/Specialist works in a team to monitor and help protect an organization from security breaches and cyberattacks. The scope includes the following: Detect and respond to security alerts/incidents (generated by SIEM, endpoint protection tools, IDS/IPS, firewalls etc) in a timely manner according to SLA and playbooks. Gather threat intelligence and research new and evolving threats and vulnerabilities which can guide the actions of the security operations. Identify potential, successful, and unsuccessful intrusion attempts and compromises through reviews and analyses of relevant event detail and summary information. Perform security scanning and testing by using the Vulnerability Assessment tools. Reporting and tracking on vulnerabilities and risks and ensure timely patching are completed to comply with stipulated resolution time. Job Requirements: 3 years hands-on experience of common security tools like SIEM software (eg. IBM Qradar), Vulnerability Assessment tool (eg. Tenable Nessus, Aquasec) and/or DAM software (eg. Data SunRise) etc Hands-on in areas like security vulnerabilities and mitigation actions, security incident response, malware analysis etc for on-prem and in cloud. CompTIA Security+ and/or AWS certification is good to have Degree in IT or any related discipline Rvin James Murillo Andalan EA License No.: 02C3423 Personnel Registration No.: R1331697 Please note that your response to this advertisement and communications with us pursuant to this advertisement will constitute informed consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of personal data by ManpowerGroup Singapore for the purpose of carrying out its business, in compliance with the relevant provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012. Do you want to work with data and analytics in the biggest sovereign wealth fund in the world? Do you want to join a team that sits at the heart of the fund's core processes and pioneers the use of cloud technology and analytics to find the most efficient way of supporting our investments? Then we have the job for you! The Role As the successful applicant you will be part of the team that operates and develops the fund's data processes and ensures the whole organisation has good quality data available for investment, trading, compliance, and risk management purposes. To find and implement new investment opportunities, the fund is always on the lookout for new data, and you will work closely with internal teams and data vendors to implement new data requirements. As a team they are continuously improving their data processes and controls and look forward to your contribution to this work through applied information technology. Norges Bank Investment Management has a performance culture, and they believe in delegation. You will be given the opportunity to excel and to make an impact. They would like you to grow into this role and develop with the team. The position is in Singapore and will report to the Head of Data Core. Some travel should be expected. What you will do This is a collaborative environment conducive to working on some of the following tasks: Develop, support, and manage data loads into and between the fund's main systems Ensure we as a team operate with sound data quality processes and that the fund's functions have good quality data available every day Further develop the fund's data warehouse and other data and analytics solutions Follow-up external data providers to ensure best-market practice and efficient processes Contributing to the development of internal tools and models using the latest available technology including cloud-based services Implement automation and identify process improvements for the team and across the organisation What you need Minimum Bachelor's degree with excellent academic records Experience from the financial industry would be good to have but not a requirement Passion and interest in data science and analytics Development skills including SQL, data analytics and cloud computing tools Who you are International curious mindset with an eagerness to learn and ambition to excel Analytical and creative with attention to details Proactive and self-driven work style and a good team player What our client offers Their core values of excellence, innovation, integrity, and team spirit underpin their culture and how they operate across all their offices. They collaborate and share information within the organisation which consists of 37 nationalities. Their organisation is grounded in trust, high ethical standards, a flat hierarchy, and diversity. Norges Bank Investment Management is committed to ensuring Equal Opportunities for all employees. Benefits include Staying healthy - They care about your health! That's why they offer excellent health, mental and dental benefits, including a comprehensive insurance for you and your family. You'll also be offered health assessments, counselling services and reimbursement of gym membership fees. Spending time with family - Becoming a parent? Don't stress! You'll get 16 weeks, gender-neutral, full base pay, parental leave to spend with your child. Mothers get an additional 10 weeks of pregnancy related leave. Recharge when you need to - All employees get 25 vacation days, and one extra for the last week of the year Work-life balance - Our client believes that a healthy balance is crucial for your well-being. When you work here, you'll be able to combine an exciting career in the world's largest sovereign wealth fund with a fulfilling life outside the office. Of course, there are several social clubs and events within the fund too if you'd like to combine the two! Planning for the long term - They contribute 17% or 20% of base salary to your CPF or SRS. You can focus on the present and don't worry about the future. Work with Purpose - Our client work to safeguard and build financial wealth for future generations. Through responsible investment and active ownership, we help shape the future of our world. Job Title System Engineer Job Description We’re looking for a System Engineer to join our Systems & Services APAC in Singapore. Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry. As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more! Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025. As a System Engineer you’ll be responsible for : Work with Architecture Manager and Proposal to support pre-sales activities : system design and illustration, BOQ generation, attending customer meeting as technically support, drafting commissioning plan; Work with Project Managers for project delivery planning and execution; Lead system commissioning process and SAT; We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch! What you’ll do Develop detailed design for the relevant programmable building blocks of the solution to deliver; Review/ verify the control design, schematics and drawings delivered by the Technical Designer; Build mock-ups to test inter-operability and/or features of the sub-system; Perform remote and on site commissioning; Record time spent on projects, productive hours, rework hours; Preparation of system testing and turnover documentation including scoped documents, test records, test procedures and other similar required documents; Oversee, and coordinate 3rd party Subcontractors as required; Participate in system turnover walkdowns for both Construction and Customer; initiate, track and resolve punchlist items for assigned areas of responsibility; Develop, train and deploy user instruction/ manuals to customer organization during handover; Work with all Stakeholders in the creation of quotes for architectures selected, system additions and upgrades; Your qualifications Diploma/Degree in Electrical, Electronics, Instrumentation, Control or Computer Engineering; Fluent in English; Be flexible with working hours (with compensation); Knowledge and experience in indoor DB (Distribution Board) or outdoor feeder pillar (OG Box), are added advantages; Knowledge and experience in indoor or outdoor lighting control system or protocol such as DALI or DMX, telecommunication systems and networks, field communication bus such as BACnet or Modbus, are added advantages; Knowledge and experience in Windows server setup, API application, LAN network and cloud application, are added advantages; CAD knowledge; Knowing any language in ASEAN region is a plus; Take initiative, accepts responsibilities and has a sense of urgency; Self-motivated, customer-oriented and a strong team player; Fresh graduates are welcome to apply. What you’ll get in return… We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences. See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees! #LI-LL1 #PridePass

Job Description Lazada’s Regional Content & Catalogue Team leverages human and technology resources to improve the structure and quality of the core eCommerce asset (catalogue, brand, and product) in order to provide a seamless buying and selling experience on our platform. We are looking for a highly motivated candidate to drive improvements to our (catalogue, brand, and product) and overall product operational efficiency. The ideal candidate will draw upon critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, and an entrepreneurial spirit with a strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive related to technology and processes. Responsibilities - Maintain the catalogue, brand, and product, setup the best-in-class data asset - Design metrics to measure catalogue quality and variety, establish best practices - Develop framework to optimize and curate process automation via catalogue self-service tool - Identify and leverage best practices in the market to automate product catalogue information filling process - Govern the catalogue and attribute structure defined by category managers, and drive category manager to fulfill catalogue operation strategy - End-to-end management and accountability of catalogue to drive relevance, cleanness, and richness of category attribute value, brand, SPU, and tag data - Identify product trend insights from catalogue data to drive seller and product onboarding endeavors - Manage catalogue related projects and resources - Able to get your hands dirty on executing catalogue changes as BAU task without affecting buyer and seller experience or internal team and system operations - Define / Execute catalogue operation strategy and roadmap, work closely with product and tech team to implement it - Work with key stakeholders across organization to drive vision and execution of processes Job Requirements - Minimum Bachelor’s degree in business, information technology, marketing, engineering or related fields - Minimum 2 years’ experience in one of related industry categories, FMCG, Fashion, General Merchandise, Electronics, or Digital Goods - Digitally-savvy with a passion for growing eCommerce businesses and optimizing the customer experience through catalogue data improvements - Ability to manage a variety of stakeholder in a fast-paced organization - Willing to travel occasionally within SE Asia & China - Experience in catalogue management with a drive to learn, grow and solve tough problems at scale

Job_Descriptions: Job Description About the company Arte Oro is a jewellery design and manufacturing atelier that aims to provide an extraordinary personal experience of creating one’s very own pieces of bespoke jewellery by translating individual stories into the jewellery. Our involvement throughout the diamond and gem supply chain gives us the global depth and reach to satisfy the most demanding clients in the world. Danilo Giannoni, our Creative Director and Founder of ARTE ORO, started the Singapore-based company in 2017. He brought with him a rich Italian heritage in jewellery making and years of international experiences from Italy, US, Middle East and Hong Kong. Today, besides Singapore, Danilo also has a workshop in Valenza,the world’s “capital” of jewellery making, with over 40 artisans working on design and craft serving European and Middle Eastern clients. We aspire to be the first local atelier attuned to creating “Made in Singapore” custom jewellery and leave a legacy for the next generation of Singaporean. Our goal is not to own the biggest jewellery company in the world, but to have the best atelier for bespoke jewellery in the world. We want you to be part of this journey with us. About the job We are currently looking for a Client Servicing Executive to support the Director and the office of Arte Oro. The ideal person for the job will be a proactive problem solver with exceptional communication skills and a meticulous attention to detail. You will cover a wide range of responsibilities that involve clients, production, design and office operations. Work with director to understand project requirements and expectations Coordinate with local and international teams in developing projects solutions to ensure quality and cost-effectiveness Manage day-to-day operations in the local factory Delegate work to individual locally and internationally Prioritise, plan and manage project activities to ensure timely delivery Monitor project workflow and resolve any issues identified Ensure project deliverables meet quality and customer expectations Investigate problems and develop logical solutions Prepare project plans, budget and schedule present project specifications and budget breakdown to managers and director for approval Supply chain matters such as liaison with local and overseas suppliers, negotiation of pricing and delivery timelines, dissemination of instructions, ensuring that goods are delivered as per discussed timelines and in good quality Administrative work - work with Admin team to adhere to compliance standards as set by the Republic of Singapore government such as Customs standards or production standards And any other duties reasonably assigned to you and when needed Other perks High autonomy Good benefits Family-like culture Connection with high-end luxury community and network Experience in high-end jewellery making/production for international clients Required skills, experiences and qualifications Initiative-taking, ownership and organisational skill are the keys for success in this role given the nature of an SME in a niche industry in Singapore. Superb written and verbal communication skills. Strong time-management skills and the ability to organise and coordinate multiple projects at once. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other office productivity tools, with aptitude to learn new software and systems. Flexible team player willing to do what it takes to get the job done adaptable and enjoys a challenge. Ability to keep company confidence. Fluent in both English and Mandarin (to communicate effectively with the production team). Preferred skills, experiences and qualifications Prior experience in a similar role as Personal Assistant to senior management or Office Manager. Experience in the high-end luxury industry or dealing with high-profile customers would be a value-add. Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends
