Job_Title: Lead Cybersecurity Engineer (Python, Automation, Vulnerability Assessment and Patch Management)
Job_Descriptions: Acronis is dedicated not just to cyber protection but to the general protection of its potential and current employees, interviews are being held virtually during the current global COVID-19 situation. Acronis is a world leader in cyber protection—empowering people by providing them with cutting-edge technology that enables them to monitor, control, and protect the data that their businesses and lives depend on. We are in an exciting phase of rapid-growth and expansion and looking for a Lead Cybersecurity Engineer who is ready to join us in creating a #CyberFit future and protecting the digital world! Acronis brings complete Cyber Protection solutions, including automatic Vulnerability Assessment and Patch Management on endpoints. As Lead Cybersecurity Engineer, you will own Vulnerability Assessment and Patch Management intelligence database creation and maintenance. You will also work closely with our cyber security researchers and other automation developers Every member of our “A-Team” has an instrumental role and impact on the success of Acronis’ innovative and growing business, so we are looking for someone who enjoys working in dynamic, global teams and thrives in a fast-paced and rapidly changing work environment. Just like everyone at Acronis, the ideal candidate will embody all of our company values: responsive, alert, detail-oriented, makes decisions, and never gives up. WHAT YOU'LL DO Design, develop and maintain automation pipelines for collecting information about new vulnerabilities and available patches. Build highly scalable, robust and fault-tolerant systems. Monitor, optimize and re-design the architecture to maximize performance of systems. Perform automated quality assurance for developed components. WHAT YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS) 3+ years of experience as Python developer, DevOps engineer or relevant positions. Experience in frameworks like Celery, Flask or Django, Pytest Experience in working with SQL (PostgreSQL) or no-SQL database like MongoDB Experience with Agile and CI/CD (continuous integration/development) tools such as Jenkins Knowledge of virtualization environments, experience of creating and controlling virtual machines in cloud. Knowledge of Linux system management and software deployment Experience with Docker and Kubernetes is preferred. Capable and willing to learn and integrate new technology (a new tool, database or programming language). Good reading and writing English skills. WHO WE ARE Acronis is revolutionizing cyber protection by integrating backup, disaster recovery, storage, next-generation anti-malware, and protection management into one solution.  This all-in-one integration removes the complexity and risks associated with non-integrated solutions and offers easy, complete and reliable data protection for all workloads, applications, and systems across any environment—physical, virtual, cloud, and mobile—all at a low cost. Founded in Singapore in 2003 and incorporated in Switzerland in 2008, Acronis is truly a global organization with more than 1,900 employees in 33 locations in 18 countries. Its solutions are trusted by more than 5.5 million consumers and 500,000 businesses, including 100% of the Fortune 1000 companies. Acronis products are available through 50,000 partners and service providers in over 150 countries in more than 30 languages. Acronis is in an exciting phase of growth and expansion, recently receiving a $250 million investment from CVC Capital Partners, bringing the total valuation to more than $2.5 billion. Acronis is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. #LI-WC1

The Company You’ll Join At Carta we create owners and make private markets liquid. We live in a world where some people live on the equity stack and enjoy exponential wealth growth and preferential tax treatment; others live on the debt stack and may work their entire lives for a company and retire only with the cash they’ve managed to save from their paychecks. Our contribution to solving the wealth inequality problem is moving people from the debt stack (payroll) to the equity stack. By making it as easy to issue equity to employees as it is to put them on payroll, we can create more owners. At Carta, we are helpful, transparent, fair, and kind. We are relentless executors, unconventional thinkers, and masters of our craft. Learn more about our Series G fundraising round here. Carta expanded to Asia in 2021, and we are building a world-class team to support the startup ecosystem across Asia Pacific. Our Asia team is lean and agile, comprised of both local venture industry experts and Cartans from other international offices. The Team You’ll Work With Carta is seeking it’s first flexible and strategic HR Manager in the APAC region who will act as a consultant to the local teams, develop and execute HR strategies, be an advocate for employees in the region, and build programs that drive organizational and people effectiveness. As the first HR hire in the APAC market, you will work with employees and leaders in Australia, India & Singapore.  You will also be part of a highly dynamic and diverse HR team with colleagues located in the US, Canada, and Brazil! You will focus on executing people initiatives, providing great internal customer support, working with local business leaders to establish, drive, and constantly evolve a people strategy that is connected with the rest of Carta, while also tailoring programs for the local workforce. The HR Manager role at Carta builds strong partnerships with the business, consistently seeks opportunities to problem solve, provides strategic and operational support to the leaders and functions you support and acts as a local expert in employment law for the region. The Problems You’ll Solve Provide professional counsel (not HR best practices for HR sake) to the local business leaders and help set the People priorities for the region Maintain in-depth knowledge of local legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance Drive the region’s People strategy to meet business objectives Partner with the business leaders to roll out key People initiatives (performance management, compensation, benefits, development programs, etc) Provide guidance and input on workforce planning, succession planning, compensation, promotions, lateral transfers, re-leveling, benchmarking, etc Act as an employee champion and change agent, proactively communicating needs with our HR department and business management Successfully influence others by providing direction, knowledge, and support to create a high-performing organization Mentor and coach managers Manage and resolve complex employee relations issues Build strong relationships with employees, management, and leadership team About You Experience working in a fast-paced global company Technology company experience preferred 6+ years of HR experience Successfully coached and influenced individual contributors and managers in a prior role Outstanding people skills – high degree of empathy and a great communicator Great organizational skills, high attention to detail, and an ability to complete competing priorities quickly Ability to interface effectively with professionals at all levels of the organization Must maintain confidentiality and use outstanding judgment on a daily basis A passion for understanding the business goals, finding solutions, and improving processes We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing a positive interview experience for every candidate. If accommodations due to a disability or medical condition are needed, connect with us via email at **********@carta.com. As a company, we value fairness, helpfulness, transparency, leadership and build our teams around these values. Check out our careers page to get to know us better as you think about your next step at Carta.

As a key member of the Center of Excellence will be responsible to provide thought leadership, develop and implement leading practices and Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) playbooks.  This person will be responsible for the deployment of our integrated business processes, train, mentor and assist S&OP teams and leaders across businesses and locations. The successful candidate will be expected to do the following: Develop roadmap for S&OP maturity for APAC Setup proper S&OP design that can be scaled as the portfolio grows and lead the roadmap and global deployment of the initiative Lead S&OP maturity assessments and build improvement plans working with business and SC leadership Own and provide the key linkage between the S&OP roadmap and the businesses supported Support S&OE (0-13 weeks) implementation at selected businesses through project management, coaching, and linkage to planning and execution systems Provide direction, coaching, subject matter expertise and management to a team of supply/demand professionals (planners, schedulers analysts), finance, commercial, supply chain (logistics, procurement, operations), technical, IT, and business leadership Develop and maintain S&OP Playbooks, implementation guides, assessment tools, training, and leading practices while coordinating input from multiple functions, businesses, and regions Work closely with teams on establishing customer SLA’s, customer/product segmentation methodologies, and dashboards as related to S&OP Collaborate with Supply Chain Systems to build planning and scheduling systems Working as the key linkage between business process and the 1ADM efforts make sure that tools are aligned to processes and support S&OP maturity to enable business success Define and Lead end-to-end supply chain business processes which include Demand Planning and Forecasting, Materials Requirement Planning (MRP), Supply Planning, Master Scheduling, and Inventory Management Thought leadership for Integrated Business Planning (S&OP) and integration of leading industry practices and research to mature ADM’s planning processes Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Business Management, Engineering or a related field (or equivalent degree) and 10+ years of relevant work experience in Supply Chain and/or Integrated Business Planning (S&OP). Master’s degree preferred Deep knowledge of end-to-end supply chain planning and recognized as expert in one or more planning dimensions (demand planning, supply planning, inventory planning, customer service, integrated business planning (S&OP)) High level skills in influencing, partnering and building consensus with stakeholders at all levels, providing well-grounded direction, recommendations and delivering on executional excellence Experience in Project/Program Management, with experience in leading successful S&OP deployments Ref ID #LI-POST

About the company Arte Oro is a jewellery design and manufacturing atelier that aims to provide an extraordinary personal experience of creating one’s very own pieces of bespoke jewellery by translating individual stories into the jewellery. Our involvement throughout the diamond and gem supply chain gives us the global depth and reach to satisfy the most demanding clients in the world. Danilo Giannoni, our Creative Director and Founder of ARTE ORO, started the Singapore-based company in 2017. He brought with him a rich Italian heritage in jewellery making and years of international experiences from Italy, US, Middle East and Hong Kong. Today, besides Singapore, Danilo also has a workshop in Valenza,the world’s “capital” of jewellery making, with over 40 artisans working on design and craft serving European and Middle Eastern clients. We aspire to be the first local atelier attuned to creating “Made in Singapore” custom jewellery and leave a legacy for the next generation of Singaporean. Our goal is not to own the biggest jewellery company in the world, but to have the best atelier for bespoke jewellery in the world. We want you to be part of this journey with us. About the job We are currently looking for a Client Servicing Executive to support the Director and the office of Arte Oro. The ideal person for the job will be a proactive problem solver with exceptional communication skills and a meticulous attention to detail. You will cover a wide range of responsibilities that involve clients, production, design and office operations. Work with director to understand project requirements and expectations Coordinate with local and international teams in developing projects solutions to ensure quality and cost-effectiveness Manage day-to-day operations in the local factory Delegate work to individual locally and internationally Prioritise, plan and manage project activities to ensure timely delivery Monitor project workflow and resolve any issues identified Ensure project deliverables meet quality and customer expectations Investigate problems and develop logical solutions Prepare project plans, budget and schedule present project specifications and budget breakdown to managers and director for approval Supply chain matters such as liaison with local and overseas suppliers, negotiation of pricing and delivery timelines, dissemination of instructions, ensuring that goods are delivered as per discussed timelines and in good quality Administrative work - work with Admin team to adhere to compliance standards as set by the Republic of Singapore government such as Customs standards or production standards And any other duties reasonably assigned to you and when needed Other perks High autonomy Good benefits Family-like culture Connection with high-end luxury community and network Experience in high-end jewellery making/production for international clients Required skills, experiences and qualifications Initiative-taking, ownership and organisational skill are the keys for success in this role given the nature of an SME in a niche industry in Singapore. Superb written and verbal communication skills. Strong time-management skills and the ability to organise and coordinate multiple projects at once. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other office productivity tools, with aptitude to learn new software and systems. Flexible team player willing to do what it takes to get the job done adaptable and enjoys a challenge. Ability to keep company confidence. Fluent in both English and Mandarin (to communicate effectively with the production team). Preferred skills, experiences and qualifications Prior experience in a similar role as Personal Assistant to senior management or Office Manager. Experience in the high-end luxury industry or dealing with high-profile customers would be a value-add.

What the role is The Scientist/Senior Scientist (Chemical Research) will be working in the Research and Exposure Science Department under the National Centre for Food Science of SFA to carry out applied chemical research to develop new analytical capabilities in support of SFA’s mission to ensure and secure a supply of safe food for Singapore. What you will be working on Conduct applied chemical research, identify problem statements, generate research hypotheses, recommend technology-based solutions, and/or determine research strategies, in support of the agency’s food safety operations, risk assessment and policies Perform laboratory analytical functions to ensure quality output and contribute to the development of new analytical capabilities Develop and validate new methodologies to tackle emerging food safety issues Develop and enhance the non-targeted screening platform for food safety early alert Plan and conduct the screening of food samples to identify potential new and emerging foodborne chemical hazards. Communicate research results through conference presentations, scientific publications, project reports that may be catered for different audience e.g. academia, scientists, policy makers and the general public Organise and maintain proper documentation of research data, scientific interpretations, and project proposals Perform supportive administrative work including procurement, drafting of project agreements What we are looking for Postgraduate degree (minimum MSc or preferably PhD) in Chemistry, Food Science, or related disciplines At least 2 years of relevant experience in research with good scientific publication record Experience in analytical chemistry laboratory testing and operation of advanced instrumentation like mass spectrometry Proficient in the design of research proposals and execution of research projects Highly motivated, self-driven to work independently in a fast-paced environment and able to multi-task Excellent written and spoken communication skills Knowledge in basic programming is desired. Hiring_Company: Ministry Of Social And Family Development
Job_Title: Assistant Manager/Senior Executive, Data & Systems Strategy (FEDS/FDG)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Reporting to the Deputy Director, you will be part of the Family Development Group (FDG) / Family eServices & Digital Solutions Division that works closely with divisions within the Ministry, partners, government agencies, Social Service Agencies and other organisations to plan, formulate and execute implementation strategies including Information and Communications Technology (ICT)/systems solutions to support existing and upcoming family programmes and initiatives. This is aligned with the push for Digital Government, to future-proof our ICT systems so as to meet the data needs for family or family-based schemes across Whole-of-Government, as well as for data analysis to enable policy reviews impacting families. As part of your job scope, you will be expected to drive FDG data and digitalisation projects to address gap limitations for FDG databases and systems, which serve FDG, MSF and WOG needs. What you will be working on Manage the planning, formulation and implementation of relevant policies surrounding family related data and systems Work with relevant stakeholders on developing analytics and ICT systems to support family policy formulation and services Work with relevant agencies on data management, data utilisation and digitisation projects Ensure data integrity within the systems for efficient utilisation of data Manage ICT and data projects to ensure timely completion of deliverables What we are looking for Tertiary education in a related discipline, preferably in Computer Science or Business Management or Statistics or Mathematics At least 3-4 years of working experience in data related and/or IT systems related projects Team player who can engage with key stakeholders Highly motivated with strong communication and interpersonal skills Able to conceptualise quickly, multi-task and work under pressure Comfortable working with figures and statistics as well as systems and computer applications

What the role is You manage and facilitate all new and upgrading infrastructure projects for MINDEF/SAF. What you will be working on On this, you facilitate and maintain close supervision over the ground activities, which includes de-conflicting construction plans and base activities to avoid disruption to base operations, throughout the projects’ different stages. You translate business and operational requirements into technical information which can be understood by engineers and contractors to execute correctly on the ground. You also enforce governance and accounting through planning and leading audits on land and real estates. Your challenge lies in managing multiple large scale constructions projects concurrently while minimising disruption to the bases’ operational readiness, as well as managing collaborative relationships with different stakeholders. What we are looking for You must have a tertiary qualification in Engineering or related field, with at least 6-8 years’ experience and technical knowledge in the construction industry. You should be possess good project management skills, governance and control knowledge as well as BI Technical knowledge. Experience in coastal construction and naval operations is advantageous. Ability to work independently with strong problem solving and co-ordination skills, a keen eye for detail as well as good inter-personal and communication skills are essential. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

What will you do? Build Out Pipeline:  You will work your contacts / networks for pipeline generation, work with the lead generation to build our pipeline.   You will follow a disciplined approach to maintaining a rolling New Business pipeline and be able to commit to close dates combining large deals with a longer pipeline and smaller deals with quicker closure rates. Sales Development: Qualify MQL to SQL through aligned and focused ICP evaluation. Participate in the development of proposals, company presentations and pitch documents for potential clients – acts as a coordination point between internal pre-sales to do so.  You will work to understand the client business issues and identify a right to win, build the relationships required to develop the lead across the sales stages to closure. GTM Execution: You will support your Director in rolling out the sales strategy to achieve your sales target based on your country, vertical and product / service allocations. This can include how you will achieve the target, the pipeline you will collaboratively grow and how you will ensure closure. Product / Services Knowledge: Using the sales kits, inductions, training provided and the brain trust from the broader practice teams, you will soak up product / service knowledge to ensure you are able to drive real value to clients. Customer success: You will sell to closure, but also ensure the client is set up for success and further cross / upselling later on. As such you will look at deals not as one offs, but also in the context of the long tail sell in. Deliver Quarterly Sales Quota:  You will hold a quarterly and yearly sales quota, you will work to ensure you hit or exceed the sales quota assigned. Constant documentation of all prospecting, qualifying, selling and closing business on SalesForce is essential. What skills and experience you will need? 3 -5 years of experience working in the digital marketing industry from either product provider, agency, consulting, brand side in a Business Development, Consulting or Sales position. Proven track record of holding sales target and hitting or exceeding these sales targets. Experience selling and working with any ad and/or marketing technology and/ or services (e.g. Digital media RFPs, Paid digital media performance, eCommerce marketplace solutions related to store set ups, onsite ad buys, content development, Brand.com Conversion Rate Optimisation, CRM, SEO, Digital marketing transformation) The ability to effectively present proposals and solutions to the decision makers An outspoken personality, socially committed character and ability to read the room An innate ‘whatever-it-takes’ mindset and a willingness to learn everyday A good sense of business acumen and understanding of the various industries Ability to meet strict deadlines whilst meeting a quality benchmark Advantageous if you have a network of customers you can bring to the role to help you get a quick start on hunting for new business.

Job_Title: Assistant / Deputy Manager (Facilities Management Digitalization - Data)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Assistant / Deputy Manager (Facilities Management Digitalization - Data) What you will be working on Identify opportunities to leverage on Facilities Management (FM) data sources to enhance operations and offer higher value-added services to the campus community. Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Organize relevant data sets and develop custom data models and algorithms to facilitate data analytics so as to gain insights for value creation. Work with systems engineers and FM partners to develop predictive maintenance and/or system optimization models for key FM sub-systems. Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy. Other adhoc assignments in support of the campus community What we are looking for Relevant background in Information Technology, Information Science, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering or IT-related disciplines. At least 3 years of experience in data management and analytics. Conversant with advanced statistical techniques and concepts, statistical computer languages (SQL, Scala, Python, SAS, Julia, R, etc.) and machine learning techniques. Candidates with good understanding of FM processes and/or digital FM solutions will have added advantage. Good understanding of IT governance and IM8 requirements. Strong problem solving, communication and interpersonal skills. Resourceful, innovative, change-ready and service-oriented.

What the role is You are responsible for the review and recommendation of measures for National Service (NS) related to the education sector. What the role is You formulate policies and strategies to ensure the build-up and sustainability of strategic capabilities in the defence industry. What you will be working on On this, you engage various stakeholders to identify potential strategic capabilities for build-up, and recommend strategies to sustain these capabilities which will ensure the defence industry’s ability to provide MINDEF/SAF with critical support and services. You also assist in the formulation of policies and implementation of frameworks to ensure good governance and strong partnership with the defence industry. You support the department with data collection and reports, as well as prepare materials and reports for meetings. Possession of good writing, communication and interpersonal skills are required. Having experience in policy or regulation is advantageous. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

What we are looking for You must have a tertiary qualification, with at least 6 years of experience preferably in contract management and handling of government tenders. Ability to work independently and in team with good communication and writing skills is essential. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

What you will be working on On this, you provide security advice to various stakeholders, as well as conduct assessments, analyse trends, identify emerging and potential concerns, before proposing suitable mitigation measures. Your challenge lies in finding suitable solutions to promptly overcome new and unforeseen circumstances arising from a fast and ever-evolving environment. What we are looking for You must have a tertiary qualification in any discipline, preferably with 3 years of security experience. (Candidates with no experience may apply.) Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Responsibilities Responsibilities Understanding Customer/Partner Technical Environment Gathers customer/partner insights from a broad range of stakeholders as well as the main business sponsor to shape and form both the definition and ongoing execution of projects. Identifies and evaluates industry trends (customer industry verticals, information technology [IT] industry). Adapts business models, plans, and solutions to insights. Works with customer/partner stakeholders (e.g., Enterprise Architects, Security Team, Development Team, Operations Team) and business sponsor to socialize both the business solution and the project approach to determine if changes are needed to the business solution. Where the cost of change is accepted by the customer, shares this feedback with the project team and the broader account team to make the necessary adjustments using mechanisms such as updating the solution approach and projected costs in presales and change requests in delivery. Contributes to Microsoft-centric operations and cadences to align with customer feedback. Uses evidence-based approach to represent the customer/partner as a customer advocate and share insights with Product Engineering teams and the business with a view to improving Microsoft technologies, products, services and offerings such that they can better meet customer/partner needs across a territory. Architecture Design and Deployment Leverages a structured approach to Architecture Projects using existing methodologies (e.g., Waterfall, Agile, Iterative) that make use of existing reference architecture and established architectural styles and design patterns. Proposes and develops new solutions to scale across multiple customers/partners. Builds and maintains an architecture description document, an architecture decisions log, and a requirements/constraints traceability matrix to ensure the rationale for the business solution's Architecture is known and understood. Defines and documents the architecture through an architecture description document, an architecture decisions log, and a requirements/constraints traceability matrix to communicate the value proposition of the business solution along with the project approach. Leads complex cost-based and technology-based discussions to explain the Architecture in terms of its build, deployment, and ongoing operational use to determine customer appetite for the business solution. Uses a business-value approach that values return on investment (ROI) and customer costs-savings over technical ease of execution. Collaborates with the Project Manager to jointly drive project/technical governance of the design, build, and deployment into use of proof of concepts (POCs) and pilots, using enterprise architecture processes and ensuring quality control through peer review. Works with customers to understand and demonstrate business value (e.g., release of revenue, cost savings) that the business solution realize. Works with the business sponsor and customer/partner stakeholders (e.g., Business users, Enterprise Architects, Security Team, Operations Team) to gather and ratify requirements and constraints. Manages and resolves complex ambiguity in the requirements and constraints and documents assumptions and implications where it cannot be resolved. Maintains the requirements/constraints traceability matrix to prove that solution components have a rationale/justification for inclusion in the architecture of the business solution. Drives development and execution of test plans to prove that each requirement/constraint has been implemented as expected by the customer. Where there are defects, works in close collaboration with the Project Manager and Customer to redress or accept and document the status of the test results. Collaborates with the Account Team and/or Bid Team to understand the business solution/problem. Drives agreement, based on the customer’s priorities, requirements/constraints, approach, principles, concepts, and expectations. Builds and documents a realistically costed, advanced/complex Solution Approach with traceability of requirements, constraints, decisions, and tradeoffs that balances risk, technical credibility, and technical innovation to meet customer need, predominantly based on existing solution offerings and/or reference architecture. Jointly leads the implementation in close partnership with the Project Manager. Leads oversight and governance and establishment of quality practices and standards to realize the business solution. Uses a cohesive build methodology with an agreed release schedule and timeline so the solution can be transitioned to live operations, leveraging solution expertise. Ensures communication of and adherence to the pre-sales value proposition. Works with the Project Manager to highlight where assumptions have proven false. Uses change requests to modify the Solution/project approach when needed. As needed, collaborates with subject matter experts to receive specialized advice that can help define the Solution and project approach and increase the time to value for the customer. Anticipates and identifies scenarios that could slow or impede pre-sales/delivery. Orchestrates the broader Microsoft team to address technical blockers and works with account/project team to resolve non-technical issues. Reports significant problems to Microsoft management and resolves escalations when needed. Plans a way forward in complex and ambiguous situations with an innovative approach and durable design. Delegates and leverages specialist skills of others to drive technical alignment across internal/external teams. Coordinates disparate approaches into a single plan of action for complex scenarios. Works in close collaboration with the Project Manager and Account Team to identify, categorize, and communicate business and technical risks. Defines risk mitigation activities that are foundational to the project plan. Defines risk contingency plans for invocation should the risk occur. Practice Development Generates new and/or improvements to existing intellectual property. Connects gaps and patterns across business and technology areas to drive changes. Identifies which ideas should be culled, with consideration for scale across customers. Drives the re-use of intellectual property and recommends practices in both pre-sales and delivery. Participates and contributes to internal/external communities. Trusted Advisor Develops a network of internal/external relationships with senior-level decision makers to build influence in addressing problems/blockers and facilitating additional views on the matter of interest. Acts as an advisor to external stakeholders. Provides direction to facilitate relationships between others. Stays up to date on Microsoft’s technologies, products, and services in order to communicate Microsoft's mission, strategy, and capabilities. Uses evidence-based arguments that articulate complex concepts in a simple manner to respectfully challenge Microsoft and customers/partners when a decision or course of action will not produce optimal results. Leverages strategic expertise to encourage alternative approaches where applicable. Serves as the "technical conscience" to challenge the status quo and unrealistic expectations. Proactively resolves conflicts and seeks resolution to balance the overall outcome. Drives consensus where possible and leads decisions to resolve conflict when needed. Leads the adoption of Microsoft solutions technologies based on understanding of competitor solutions and how customer business value can be driven through Microsoft's offerings. Differentiates Microsoft's solutions in customer/partner conversations to influence the industry-wide direction for specific architecture(s). Thought Leadership Leads virtual teams around technologies and customer/partner challenges by sharing ideas, insight, and strategic, technical input with technical teams, internal communities across the field, and the larger virtual team across Microsoft using knowledge of Microsoft architectures and their context in the competitive landscape. Participates in external architect community events (e.g., conferences, seminars, technical meetups, Webcasts, blogs, hackathons) and shares learnings with internal team. Acts a mentor to junior colleagues by educating them on technical and non-technical concepts and sharing best practices. Demonstrates deep industry knowledge and drives recognition for Microsoft solutions through presentations and engagements with external audiences. Qualifications Qualifications Required/Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field AND 8+ years experience in technology solutions, practice development, architecture, consulting, and/or technology domain (Data) OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field AND 6+ years experience in technology solutions, practice development, architecture, consulting, and/or technology domain (Data) OR equivalent experience. Additional or Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field AND 12+ years experience in technology solutions, practice development, architecture, consulting, and/or technology domain (Data) OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field AND 8+ years experience in technology solutions, practice development, architecture, consulting, and/or technology domain (Data) OR equivalent experience 6+ years technical pre-sales experience. Technical or Professional Certification in Domain (Data) Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is anchored on embracing a growth mindset, where anyone can change, learn, and grow. Four attributes allow this growth mindset to flourish: obsessing over what matters to our customers, becoming more diverse and inclusive in everything we do and create, operating as one company instead of multiple siloed businesses and lastly, making a difference in the lives of each other, our customers and the world around us. You can help us build our culture and achieve our mission. The Global Partner Solutions team mission is to: build and sell intelligent cloud and intelligent edge solutions with partners, empowering people and organizations to achieve more. GPS is a sales organization accountable for the commercial partner business at Microsoft. Building on the GPS mission, the GSI mission is to grow Partner Mind & Wallet share and double our contribution to Microsoft cloud consumption. The Global System Integrator (GSI) Group within Global Partner Solutions group (GPS) manages key relationships with our top SI partners who have significant global scale and a collective strength of over a 1 million technology professionals. We are looking for an exceptional leader who can enable our partners to rapidly scale their business on Microsoft multi cloud strategy through the development of Services and Solutions and co-sell via Microsoft multiple channels. In this role, you will help our GSI Partners, pursue go-to-market opportunities and land key customer wins in. This is a unique role at the Asia Pacific level that adds value both to Microsoft and to our partners. The Partner Development Manager GSI is responsible for the 360 degree business relationship with Global SIs that sell, service and support Microsoft’s cloud solutions. The PDM is the pivotal role in the relationships Microsoft builds with partner companies. They are responsible for engaging at the very highest level of  executives building trust by sharing insights about how companies can capitalize on market opportunities by partnering with Microsoft. PDMs lead the building of joint business plans defining solutions portfolio, Go-To-Market, sales and marketing strategies, driving implementation of all aspects of the strategy by orchestrating relationships between the partners technical, sales and marketing teams and Microsoft’s to ensure excellence in execution of the strategy and achieving partnership growth goals and sales targets. Responsibilities Key Accountabilities:: Help partners transform and grow their business in the cloud by developing comprehensive Partner Business Plans for a portfolio of partners to identify short and long-term strategic goals and tactical execution. Builds strong relationships with Microsoft and partner resources to design a portfolio of differentiated Cloud solutions across Microsoft’s three clouds: Azure, Dynamics365 and Microsoft 365 underpinned with Security Guides partners to build a solutions portfolio aligned with market opportunities and defines roadmap to evolve to multi-cloud (Azure,Dynamics365 and Microsoft 365). Identify a joint sales strategy and have a sales plan in place with the partner. Track pipeline health on key deals to accelerate sales momentum and cloud consumption. Actively review and drive top opportunities and accelerate them to closure by removing partner blockers. Ensure hand-offs to and engagements with the appropriate resources at the appropriate sales phase, to maximize win probability and minimize time to close, make proper decisions resolve issues with local leadership and escalate as required. Identify an effective path to market with solutions and Go-To-Market (GTM) activities Drive performance management of partners through monthly/quarterly reviews to review overall business performance across the organization and to measure against partners’ transformation goals and business plan. Drive continuous portfolio optimization of partners’ performance as measured by revenue, pipeline, consumption, usage and partner impact. Develop strategic content and differentiators that will allow better positioning of our alliance with the GSI internally and externally. Qualifications Deep understanding of digital transformation business drivers, cloud platforms, capabilities and solutions that generate partner growth and innovation. 8 -12+ years of experience in core sales management, partner channel development, sales, business development, alliance management in the technology industry Deep strategic advisor and executive relationship management experience driving sales with partners in commercial businesses. Strong experience of managing virtual teams across functions and geographies: Strong influence and orchestrator skills helping align Microsoft and partner resources to drive solutions that support customer needs. Inclusive and collaborative – driving teamwork and cross-team alignment Familiarity in the Global System Integrators a strong plus. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. Industry leading healthcare Savings and investments Giving programs Educational resources Maternity and paternity leave Opportunities to network and connect Discounts on products and services Generous time away

Job_Title: Development Partner/Senior Development Partner, Business Environment & Resources
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Business Environment & Resources (BER) team is looking for a new member in our team. BER’s goals are to study the impact of various domestic regulations on local enterprises and their business costs, and to enable an environment where local enterprises can thrive and grow. In the face of cost pressures in Singapore, BER also ensures that SMEs have continued access to land and space to grow their businesses. What you will be working on Your role will involve the administration and review of land policies relating to the industrial property market to ensure sustained economic growth and creation of good jobs. In addition, you are expected to support industry officers in their engagements with local enterprises on land and regulatory matters. What we are looking for You must be passionate about helping businesses - particularly local SMEs - succeed, so that they continue to create good jobs for Singaporeans. You should be curious and willing to explore new ideas. You should have an analytical mind: able to research thoroughly, find sources of data, and make connections to prove your case. Preferably, you would have some knowledge of Singapore's land use policies or have some experience with data analysis.

What we are looking for Driven, energetic, and highly-motivated who is equipped with good analytical, partnership management, networking and communication (written & spoken) skills. Candidates with 2-3 years of relevant working experience with SMEs or heartland enterprises would be preferred. If you are shortlisted for the position, you may be required to complete a preliminary online interview and written assessment. Successful candidates will be shortlisted for further interview.

Job_Title: Development Partner / Senior Development Partner, Spore-India Partnership Office
Job_Descriptions: What the role is What you will be working on You will join the Singapore-India Partnership Office (SIPO) team on its mission to strengthen and diversify Singapore's economic relations with India. Based in Singapore, you will help Singapore companies to enter into India, navigate through regulatory frameworks and business norms, and establish strategic contacts with overseas counterparts. You will closely engage with India and Singapore's officials, India's local business houses, identify key growth industries, develop strategies and projects to help Singapore companies establish a niche in India. To thrive as a member of our team, you welcome the challenge of working in a complex and dynamic environment, and be flexible in responding to ambiguity and uncertainty. You enjoy opportunities to initiate and facilitate the execution of projects across many different sectors with partners in Singapore and India. What we are looking for Besides being independent, tenacious and resilient and resourceful, you should also possess good business acumen and strong analytical skills. IDPD spearheads the implementation of the Environmental Services Industry Transformation Map (ES ITM) to promote the growth and competitiveness of the industry. Job_Title: Senior Business Partner / Business Partner, Business & Trade Insights
Job_Descriptions: What the role is You will be part of Enterprise Singapore’s Planning team responsible for generating data insights to inform and help guide the Organisation’s policies and strategies for the business and trade community, as well as for the relevant Ministries and the public. You will report and forecast Singapore’s official trade statistics as the national trade data custodian, represent Singapore at international trade data/ standards fora, ensure compliance with international standards, by working closely with key stakeholders across government agencies. What you will be working on You will undertake data-driven studies and analysis to substantiate Enterprise Singapore’s narrative and thought leadership, with aim of delivering Board-wide insights. This includes primary research for areas strategic to ESG including enterprise and trade trends, conduct survey on the state of productivity, internationalisation and innovation of enterprises, impact assessments for key policies, as well as develop dashboards and framework for monitoring and business/trade sensing. In addition, you will advise divisions within and beyond the organisation on the appropriate statistical standards and methodology, including for surveys, interviews and consultancy studies. What we are looking for You should have a good degree preferably in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or a relevant discipline with substantial quantitative content. You should possess strong analytical (both quantitative and qualitative), oral and written communication skills, with the ability to learn and apply statistical and analytical tools/ techniques for data compilation and analysis. Ability to present complex research and data findings in an easily understandable manner to the broad audience and generate actionable insights is a plus. You should also develop a good understanding of policies and programmes for businesses. You should be attentive to details, a self-starter and effective team player who possess the ability to work independently and in cross-functional teams.

Job_Title: Development Partner / Senior Development Partner, Education
Job_Descriptions: What the role is What you will be working on As a member of the Education team, you will manage companies in the Education sector, which include various types of education services companies ranging from early childhood, preschool, to enrichment and training and adult education. Developing good relationships with the companies and relevant industry stakeholders is key to ensuring timely, insightful and meaningful engagement to drive industry growth and economic contributions to Singapore. You are required to understand the enterprises' growth plans and strategies, and identify areas of assistance to facilitate their capabilities upgrading, growth and overseas expansion. Being able to provide the best possible execution for projects and dynamic management of relationships to ensure the most satisfactory outcome for the sector is necessary. Your role includes developing and delivering sectoral programmes, managing projects and stakeholders, and promoting the adoption of best practices for the industry. Education Technology (EdTech) is a key enabler for the education industry and is increasingly playing a prominent role in delivering effective learning outcomes and deepening engagement among parents, teachers and students. You will also be involved in the exciting role of developing and managing the EdTech eco systems and its incumbents, enabling partnerships and collaborations between EdTech and the education corporates for innovation and growth. What we are looking for You should be results-oriented, able to demonstrate strong business acumen and strategic thinking. Good communication and writing skills, and the ability to perform under pressure will put you in good stead. You must be able to work in a collaborative environment but also able to independently organize and deliver on the assigned projects. Some business travel for this role would be required. Candidates with three to four years of relevant working experience in the Education sector would be preferred.

Job_Title: Development Partner/Senior Development Partner, Scale Up (Enterprise Leadership)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is About Enterprise Singapore's Enterprise Leadership The Enterprise Leadership department in Enterprise Singapore (ESG) supports business leaders of promising small and medium enterprises in achieving the next bound of growth. This is achieved through close partnerships with institutes of higher learning, public and private sector partners with the necessary expertise and capacity to deliver, and alignment of interests, to help business leaders grow their businesses. What you will be working on We are seeking a dynamic and motivated team player to join us in shaping and executing value creation initiatives at scale, with the objective of helping Singapore enterprises in their next phase of growth and transformation. This position is for a self-starter who is able to understand and manage multiple stakeholder demands whilst having an appreciation for business growth and strategies in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment. Key Responsibilities include ▪ Developing strategies and action plans to grow and nurture our community of promising Singapore enterprises ▪ Working closely with Programme Managers (Institutes of Higher Learning) and ESG business units such as Industry Clusters, Global Markets and Programmes & Policies teams to (i) plan and execute programmes that will enable scale and systematic execution; and (ii) assess and identify promising enterprises for deeper engagement and support ▪ Facilitating connections across promising enterprises and the programme's wider networks to enable peer learning and collaboration, and access to commercial opportunities ▪ Providing timely reporting of programme feedback and management of data, which includes Programme Partners' deliverables and fund disbursements ▪ Assessing, monitoring and sharing the impact and effectiveness of the programme of both qualitative and quantitative data What we are looking for 3 years of public and/or private sector working experience, with a focus in commercial roles (e.g. business development, corporate strategy, partnerships and project management) Preferred Attributes include: ▪ Strong business judgement, collaborative mindset with experience in managing diverse stakeholders ▪ Excellent verbal and written communication skills ▪ Strong organisational, written and communication skills ▪ Analytical mind and meticulous with strong attention to detail ▪ Ability to work under pressure ▪ A passion for public service and in championing the growth of local enterprises

What the role is Infrastructure Asia (IA) is set up by Enterprise Singapore and Monetary Authority of Singapore. IA will work closely with the local and international partners across the infrastructure value chain, including infrastructure developers, institutional investors, multilateral & commercial banks, and technical, legal, accounting & financial services providers to provide solutions that are customised and good fit; to meet the specific project needs and requirements in Asian countries. We will also offer advice to relevant Asian countries and work with them on capacity building. As a focal point of knowledge, skills and resources, we can contribute to improving project feasibility and bankability, enabling more project leads to become viable commercial projects. What you will be working on Through in-depth interaction with local & international players and Asian governments, continuously update a pipeline of potential projects in the region; Match-make governments with infrastructure needs to Singapore-based firms; Organize Capacity Building & Connecting workshops together with our MOU partners (e.g. the World Bank Group, Singapore Business Federation) for focused countries & sub-segments; Advise regional governments in infrastructure project structuring (including alongside our MOU partners, like the World Bank Group); and, Assist IA senior team to prepare and participate in external events to build mindshare and thought leadership for Asian Infrastructure. What we are looking for Minimum of 1-2 years of work experience preferable, candidates without experience are welcome to apply (for Lead position) and at least 8-10 years of work experience (for Senior Lead position) in the infrastructure sector or in a relevant sub-segment, with a majority (or recent) focus on business development; Driven, enterprising, takes ownership in driving projects to achieve results; Excellent negotiation, persuasion and written-communication skills (any additional Asian language skills is a plus); Strong analytical skills; Willingness to travel frequently; Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment; and, Experience in financing or structuring solutions for infrastructure projects or companies is a plus.

Hogarth Worldwide is the world’s leading creative content production company. Born to make the  best work brilliantly, we combine craft, insight and technology to bring creative work to life for many of the world’s most famous brands. The Web Developer needs to build/modify responsive web pages using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc. based on the visual briefs. You will need to work on localization of the page based on the assets provided which includes updating links, images and text, in accordance to the client’s coding standards. You must be enthusiastic about technology and constantly be looking at the next innovation. On top of possessing strong oral, interpersonal and organizational abilities, you must be able to work in a fast paced environment. Flexibility and tolerance is a necessity. You will be rewarded with training and mentoring from the senior development team within an excellent team atmosphere. This vacancy is for upcoming short-term projects that will happen intermittently throughout the year. Each project is likely to last between 3-5 weeks and would require the team to work full days on-site at the office. Responsibilities Use the provided frameworks and automation tools to produce microsites for partner and reseller CMSs Test all work in situ in partner sites to ensure partners can take the whole code and put it in their CMS without further coding (except for adding their custom links) Prettify code and name assets clearly and consistently to make it easy for partners to use code. Consult the Partner ReadMe and the provided documentation. To ensure code and file naming follows accepted guidelines Validate code using offline tools Develop new digital assets as identified by supervisor and management Modify existing code to accommodate for a locale – including changing image paths, server-side includes (SSI), file names, directories, other elements, and other development tasks Ensure all your work is performed according to the brief and the minimum requirements for each client Develop fast and efficiently to meet tight deadlines Produce digital assets in several languages Update and amend existing assets Maintain client digital assets to the best of your ability using clean, accessible mark-up according to the latest web standards Help and advise project managers with client’s digital requests Keep an eye on the latest trends to help boost development efficiencies Awareness of the client’s mobile platform with the ability to build solutions that take advantage of the latest operating system features while remaining performant on the latest devices Qualifications A minimum of 6 years commercial development experience within an agency Able to work independently and efficiently to meet deadlines Fluent in English, written and oral, due to the nature of the work Self-motivated, detail-oriented and organised Expertise in web languages and standard technologies, including version control systems (SVN and GIT), repositories and build tools (Gulp) Proficiency in HTML/HTML5, CSS/CSS3 and JavaScript/JQuery Responsive development experience Exposure to Front-End Frameworks (Foundation) Image manipulation software (Photoshop, InDesign) and able to slice elements out of a PSD Accessible and SEO based coding Self starter who is able to hand-code front-end NOT using any WYSIWYG tools like Dreamweaver and keen to learn new technologies Clear understanding of Usability Proficient in developing to W3C Standards Knowledge of the challenges of Email newsletter builds. Ability to work with MJML and in-house MJML automation tools Progressive enhancement and graceful degradation Experience with optimization for mobile devices and familiarity with responsive and adaptive methods Excellent attention to detail Must be able to travel as required #LI-EL1 Diversity and Inclusion Hogarth is committed to diversity and inclusion, through our ideas, our people, how we behave and conduct ourselves. Citi Markets Operations is currently at a pivotal point in its evolution and journey to implement a target operating model. We take pride and are passionate about our People and our culture. We are invested in our People and their development. We are transforming and simplifying our operating model, creating an exciting environment which encourages diversity of thought and inclusion. We are a dynamic, global, and diverse Organisation, with a presence in over 60 Countries; covering all front post execution Operations teams including product aligned Middle Oﬃce groups, Settlements, Margin, Asset Servicing, Listed Derivative & Commodities Operations. We support an extensive range of Capital Markets products and services including Fixed Income (FX, Rates, Credit, Muni, Cash and  Derivatives) where Citi is consistently a dominant top 3 player in the market, Equity (Cash, Derivatives, Prime Brokerage, Futures, Listed Derivs, FXPB) where Citi has a signiﬁcant growth program to continue to build out its capabilities and services; and Syndicates where we support both FI and EQ new issues and IPOs. Our Operations groups are core to the success of the Markets business and have  signiﬁcant impact across the lifecycle of a trade. We partner extensively with a range of internal stakeholders including Front Oﬃce Sales and Trading Desks, Compliance, Legal, Finance and HR; alongside having signiﬁcant interaction with our external client base, playing a key role in the overall client experience. We have a  Client relationship group, dedicated to overseeing the Organizational service performance and strategic partnership for our top tier client base, where we play a key role in supporting our global clients to ensure they have a ﬁrst-class experience when doing business with Citi. Job Description The Client Service role is a junior level position responsible for delivering excellent Client Service for clients across Asia Pacific. The overall objective is to support the firm’s client trading across a broad range of listed futures & options, OTC & FX PB products.  The individual will contribute to enhancing the operational relationship for clients, and drive Client solutions through Local, Regional & Global initiatives as well as measuring service through metrics and client feedback. Responsibilities: Core responsibilities of FCX Clients Service role include but not limited to the following: Key point of contact for Clients leveraging expert business, industry, and operational knowledge to identify value added client solutions. Liaise with ETD & OTC Clearing and Margin Operations teams to resolve Client trade bookings and allocation, margining, commissions & fees issues in timely and accurate manner Daily review of Clients’ statements and reporting and Margining of Clients’ Futures & OTC positions cleared with Citi Responsibilities also include integrity of account opening / on-boarding activities, to ensure timeliness of account setup and data quality Ensures legal, regulatory and operational control requirements are maintained across their assigned diverse complex customer base on an ongoing basis Performs Risk Controls Self Assessments (RCSA) testing to ensure dynamic controls. Participate with Sales Originations, Relationship Sales, Implementation, Operations teams for new Client on-boarding and additional account openings Helps to identify the source/cause of significant customer issues so that they can be eliminated Participate in change initiatives designed to enhance client experience, operations scalability and controls Basic Qualifications: 1-3 years relevant experience Effective verbal and written skills Effective communication and analytical skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong team player who works well in a global and regional team environment Ability to influence change and implement process improvements is essential Education: Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience Preferable qualifications: Exposure to one or more of the following would be preferred; Exchange Traded Derivatives, OTC Clearing , Collateral Management and or Prime Brokerage Exposure to key industry systems, e.g. GMI, OCR/EGUS, Oasys, Omgeo, Cloud Margin Experience in metrics and management reporting Additional Asian language skills such as Japanese, Mandarin Chinese, Korean would be beneficial ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Commercial and Business Sales ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: Client Service ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Job_Title: Loyang Site Facility, EHS & Security Section Manager M/F
Job_Descriptions: Position description Posting title Loyang Site Facility, EHS & Security Section Manager M/F Regular/Temporary Regular Job description To effectively manage the Loyang site EHS program, targets & management system. To upkeep facilities (and security) equipment, electrical appliances and building services, in cost effectiveness method, by periodic review its scope of work. To collaborate with (outsourced) security agency, to safeguard the site & mitigate risks, with the aid of security system. To ensure the compliance to all companies polices, SOP, ISO Standard, EHS rules, government regulations, site and corporate security procedures. To work closely with corporate integrated facilities management vendor on general maintenance of all facilities systems related to building, inclusive of control, electrical, air-conditioning, mechanical ventilations, fire protection and security systems. Review and assist management committee in activities related to planning, design and modifications of materials, processes, operations or building layouts. Coordinate and facilitate Facility & EHS&S program evaluation and management review. Liaison between all EHS&S activities with site management, department managers, and corporate. Coordinate all local EHS&S programs and regional assignments. Assess EHS&S conditions, report to site management on EHS&S performance, and to consult and advise senior management of recommendations for improvement, including appropriate prevention and control strategies. Work with management committee to develop and implement company EHS&S policies, management system and programs. Provide guidance on corporate EHS&S policies, directions and strategies to the management committee. Implement a process that ensure EHS&S compliance issues are effectively managed to closure by the management committee. Set up and monitor progress of EHS&S and assist management committee to develop EHS&S plans. Analyze trends and report to senior management and to the corporation on progress of goals/targets and objectives. Actively engage line organization in the implementation of EHS&S programs through providing support on communication, training, assessment and control of hazards and risks. Review current and proposed legislation, advise management committee to integrate legal and other requirements into the operations to ensure compliance. Develop and manage incident investigation, inspection and audit programs; identify root causes of deficiencies and assist management committee in the implementation of corrective and preventive measures. Evaluate assessments performed and control measures proposed or implemented to ensure that recommendations are appropriate. Develop a strategy for management committee to implement and mitigate EHS&S risks associate with all contractor activities. Profile Certification / Qualifications in Facilities Management / Environment, Health & Safety and Security and/or other relevant discipline combined with tertiary level qualifications. With at least 5 years’ experience in similar capacity in a manufacturing and / or logistics environment ISO 14001 / OHSAS 18001 / ISO 22301 knowledge preferred Strong knowledge in EHS&S practices & local EH&S statutory regulations Must be a registered Workplace Safety and Health Officer (WSHO) Fire Safety Manager (FSM) is preferred. Ability to engage, communicate, build credibility, lead change and influence operational management Proven ability to drive results in a demanding work environment Proficient in Microsoft computer application skills Auto-CAD skills is advantages. Position location Job location Asia-Pacific, Singapore, Loyang Candidate criteria Education level required 3 - Upper secondary education diploma Experience level required 6-10 years Languages English (2- Business fluent) Requester Desired start date 01/02/2022

Job_Descriptions: APJ Consumer Display Pricing Senior Advisor or Consultant Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company — we are a people company. We inspire, challenge, and respect every one of our over 100,000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities.  We take pride in fostering a winning, innovative, inclusive employee culture, and we take calculated risks and we celebrate big victories when they pay off. To be part of this family, join us as a Display Pricer in our fast growing APJ Consumer Display & Client Peripherals team. Operating in a competitive business environment, we need innovative pricing strategies, and as pricer you are responsible for developing, implementing and evaluating these strategies, conducting research and competitive pricing analysis, and monitoring the ongoing business environment to ensure Dell maintains a competitive market position Key Responsibilities Ensure our Monitor price positions are aligned to our pricing strategy, overall business objectives (revenue, market & share targets), & product positioning in countries To support this, model and summarize the impact of changes in market prices, price positions, costs, currencies Together with the country brand leaders, develop full quarter product mix & promotion plans Within quarter, review performance of products, and recommend required price changes and get buy-in from key stakeholders Develop inputs for Channel/retail sales price, based on Omni channel pricing strategy and recommendations of Price proposal Give input to the product group team on developing the right product for our markets at the right cost Create Price proposals for new product launches Support Brand managers in discussions with the commercial CP Pricer as Topic Specialist Essential Requirements End User Pricing experience across any B2C domain IT industry experience with displays and client peripherals, (i.e., Product Marketing, Sales, Brand management), preferably in consumer space 8-10 years pricing, marketing, merchandising, sales, sales support, or finance experience Strong analytical/problem solving ability and proficiency with creating models in Excel Ability to handling complexity using 80/20 approach Ability to transform data into insights into actions Able to deal with ambiguity Experience working in a fast-paced environment Independent pro-active self-starter with strong sense of ownership & accountability Ability to work independently with virtual & cross-functional teams across Asia Good verbal and written communication and influencing skills

Senior Service Delivery Engineer - Mainframe Dell Technologies customers rely on our products and services to drive progress. So we take the service we provide extremely seriously. Service Delivery is all about making sure our technical solutions help clients fulfil their priorities, challenges and initiatives. As trusted advisors, we build in-depth knowledge of what each client wants to achieve. Then we make sure the services delivered by Dell Technologies deliver on all our promises. We also work closely with Sales and Global Services colleagues to develop strategic account growth plans, and to identify and pursue sales opportunities. Join us as a Senior Engineer on our Professional Services team in Singapore to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact. What you’ll achieve As a Service Delivery Engineer, you will provide world-class delivery support to our customers by building an in-depth knowledge of our customers’ priorities and initiatives and becoming a trusted advisor that avoids customer impact and facilitates continuous improvement. You will identify potential sales and growth opportunities and will partner with key stakeholders to maximize these prospects. You will: Provides proactive recommendations to the customer for improving their use of DELLEMC/STORAGE/IBM MAINFRAME storage solutions to help maximize their satisfaction with DELLEMC/STORAGE/IBM MAINFRAME. Actively contributes to the configuration, layout and performance tuning of DELLEMC/STORAGE/IBM MAINFRAME products. Participates in the design and operational execution of the customer's disaster recovery process as required. Performs necessary storage infrastructure maintenance and necessary data migration, as required. Provides assistance to DELLEMC/STORAGE/IBM MAINFRAME technical teams in the development of custom solutions and implementation preparation. Responsible for performing daily operational tasks, storage provisioning and maintaining availability at the customer site(s). Provisions solutions based on standardized procedures as outlined by DELLEMC/STORAGE/IBM MAINFRAME best practice documentation. Installs DELLEMC/STORAGE/IBM MAINFRAME software products in the Open Systems hardware environment. Performs complex and/or extended-stay software implementations per the specifications in the Statement of Work, Scope document, Architecture Design Document or Project Manager direction Successfully manages relations with Customers utilizing negotiation and influencing skills to acquire the internal and external resources necessary for optimal results. May occasionally be called upon to act as a backup to the Project Manager or to provide team technical leadership on specific implementations. Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements Ability to work in a team environment Proficiency in hardware, software and/or operating systems environments Strong technical aptitude Knowledge of the technical aspects of hardware/software subject matter Customer Service skill Desirable Requirements Bachelors’ Degree Additional language skills preferred Here’s our story; now tell us yours Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here. Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

Company Description Domino’s Pizza, which began in 1960 as a single store location in Ypsilanti, MI, has had a lot to celebrate lately: we’re a reshaped, reenergized brand of honesty, transparency and accountability – not to mention, great food! In the rise to becoming a true technology leader, the brand is now consistently one of the top five companies in online transactions and 65% of our sales in the U.S. are taken through digital channels. The brand continues to ‘deliver the dream’ to local business owners, 90% of which started as delivery drivers and pizza makers in our stores. That’s just the tip of the iceberg…or as we might say, one “slice” of the pie! If this sounds like a brand you’d like to be a part of, consider joining our team! Job Description The Analytics & Insights team has been a key contributor to driving Domino’s industry-leading sales growth by pairing strategic thought leadership with the latest analytic techniques in the fields of data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and primary research. This Specialist role reports to the Manager of Asia Analytics & Insights.   This individual will primarily be tasked with helping to drive sales in our largest Asia Pacific markets by consulting with our Master Franchisees’ analytics and insights teams. This role will also collaborate with International marketing, business consulting, digital, technology, supply chain, and training teams to identify opportunities and set priorities for Domino’s markets worldwide.  Success in this role requires a combination of analytics expertise, consulting, and training skillsets to support Master Franchisees at different stages of analytical complexity.   GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES Consult Domino’s Asia Pacific markets on key topics such as pricing and offers analytics, digital analytics, product development, media effectiveness, and design of experiment. Develop a strong understanding of the business, the challenges, and demonstrate the ability to identify additional growth opportunities that can be acted upon Establish strong understanding of the broader Analytics & Insights department initiatives and methodologies Develop relationships and provide guidance to our Master Franchisees and internal business partners Present best practices and recent findings to both internal and international leadership teams Take lead role in further development/innovation of analytic tools to support the international field organization Build a strong working knowledge of the many internal and external data sources to leverage Mine and synthesize across data sources to help address opportunities leveraging SQL and other analytic techniques Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Business Administration, Economics or another related field 5+ years professional related experience or Master’s in one of the fields listed above, or 3+ years in a leading management consulting company Proficient in SQL if possible Strong PowerPoint presentation building and communication skills Experience in advanced analytics techniques, including regression, analysis of variance, pre-post assessment, break-even analyses, and/or time series modeling Able to manage and prioritize multiple projects at once Ability to travel up to 10% Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
