Telenor Group is a leading telecommunications company across the Nordics and Asia with 188 million customers. We are committed to responsible business conduct and driven by the ambition of empowering societies. Connectivity has been Telenor’s domain for more than 160 years, and our purpose is to connect our customers to what matters most. We have a leading Nordic position in mobile, broadband and TV services, as well as substantial activities in subsidiaries and joint venture operations, including mobile financial services and online classifieds in the Asia region. Worldwide, Telenor Group and our operations’ teams are 16,000 people strong. Telenor Procurement Company (TPC), established in 2017 and headquartered in Singapore, operates as a subsidiary of the Telenor Group.  We deliver Global Category Management as a service to the Telenor Business Units, taking full responsibility for the end-to-end Sourcing process and performance of global spend categories. Functioning as one Global Procurement team across all Telenor markets, we enable Telenor’s strategic ambitions by becoming a centre of expertise in the pursuit of efficient operations.  TPC seeks qualified procurement professionals that are comfortable working in a global setup in the fast-paced Telecom field. About the Role As the Category Specialist, you will be part of the TPC ISIT Sourcing team and will report to the Head of category/category director. You will work closely with Telenor Group functions and all of the Telenor Business Units. The objective of this position is to perform analyses to support category strategy, demand management, managing the category target & use benchmarking tools actively to ensure category and business performance. Your role is pivotal in identifying and realizing cost saving initiatives that deliver real business value in the category across all of Telenor’s Business Units. Main tasks Contribute to  E2E Category strategy development Perform analysis to support category strategy work Collaborate with user departments for preparing and executing the strategy, innovative analysis and proactively addressing procurement needs Identify, lead and execute cost saving initiatives that deliver value in the procurement of goods and services for the company Manage resources and stakeholders in a sourcing process Prepare and lead TCO analysis during procurement processes and participate in negotiations Implementation of category sourcing strategy and skilled approach to vendor management Ensure contract management, implementation and follow-up activities Understand supply market and perform thorough supplier prequalification for respective category Maintain an awareness of latest buying techniques and theories and develop application within the company Sourcing Execution for Global Framework Agreements Post contract management activities Manage contracts and price book relevant to the category Handle dispute with global suppliers & stakeholder To enjoy this role and succeed in it you would need to be/have: Strong business knowledge in telecommunications landscape Deep insight into end to end Sourcing process and strategies. Strong ability to communicate and interact effectively across organizational and cultural boundaries, internal and external Result oriented, demonstrating excellent collaboration abilities Able to work with a high degree of execution power and passion Understand the vendor market Strong analytical, systems thinking and problem solving capabilities Demonstrate commitment, maturity, flexibility and speed in response to business and challenges Possess Commercial and negotiation skills Highly creative and innovate mindset Knowledge of sourcing techniques and demand management & demand forecasting methods Familiar with contract setup activities such as specification definition, contract T&C setup High level of integrity and ethics Qualification and Experience Requirements Bachelor degree in Technology, Finance or Business or equivalent. Minimum 2 years in a procurement / contract management / vendor management role preferably with experience in IT area Proficient in use of MS Excel, performing data analyses and co-relation using and processing tools, e.g. ThinkCell., Excel or Tableau to be Able to produce and draw conclusions based on the analysis ITIL and/or SAM certifications preferred

As Business IT and Solutions Delivery Manager, the incumbent will: Support implementation of projects/ enhancements to Singapore and Overseas users including requirement gathering and acceptance tests Provide first level BAU support to users in system functionality and issues resolution Manage and maintain product parameters/features and standing data Conduct system/functionality training on systems Responsibilities Support BUs and Overseas Offices in performing gap analysis, documenting user requirements, preparing test scripts, conducting testing and health checks Investigate and troubleshoot systems issues encountered and work with IT to resolve the issues Work closely with the BUs in ensuring that the systems' features and functionalities are utilized in an optimal and standardized manner, strengthening internal controls and improve overall operational efficiency Qualifications Requirements Degree holder with minimum of 3-4 years business analyst experience in banking industry with preference in business banking Possess good interpersonal & communication skills with the ability to communicate and work effectively with team members and system users Strong analytical skills with ability to assimilate information quickly and gain consensus from multiple stakeholders when required Possess critical thinking and problem-solving skills Knowledge of systems for loans origination, credit limits and collaterals management will be a plus

Role and responsibilities Expand the scope of IT assets addressed by the operational vulnerability management process in order that scanning and analysis are performed for all digital services. Provide InfoSec risk and threat analysis and be able to justify vulnerability and threat characterisations when challenged. Strengthen the dexterity of security logging and monitoring such that logging and monitoring enable insight into application behaviour as well as general IT infrastructure. Find back doors and miss-direct attackers by taking a view of vulnerability over and above the output of vulnerability scanners and pen test tools and by managing, maintaining and monitoring cyber HONEY POTS. Act as a leader promoting the adoption and use of the MITRE and STRIDE frameworks across the Security Operations team globally. Key requirements Demonstrate significant experience in IT security and IT infrastructure security, security vulnerability management and cyber threat hunting. Be educated to at least degree level ideally in Computing Science or Information Security or Cyber Security. Be familiar with log analysis/data analysis tools like ELK and be able to leverage such tools to accelerate the analysis of a suspect security incident. Demonstrate energy and tenacity and the ability to deliver threat and vulnerability analysis in time-critical and sometimes demanding situations. Have an implicit sense of placing technology and data risk in a business context by pro-actively developing a sound understanding of how the business harnesses data and technology as well as the forensics of cyber security. Job_Title: Sales & Marketing Business Internship Programme 2022 - SG
Job_Descriptions: Overview of the programme The program will be working with the business side of the company with main focus on Sales and Marketing. The Sales and Marketing team is essential to the continuing growth of our business. These are the teams that develop new investment products, tell clients about them and manage relationships to make sure the right clients choose the right products. It's dynamic and fascinating part of Fidelity International. What you'll be doing This is a big opportunity to build your knowledge on the Wholesale, Private Banking channel and/or Marketing in this internship. We will assign you to one of the business departments where you will spend 6 months. Singapore is the Hub of our South East Asia business and you'll be exposed to the region and the different business landscapes. You will be given great opportunities to develop your interpersonal skills through participating in cross functional projects. Rest assured, you'll return to university with an international perspective on investment sales and marketing. Interns will be assigned to one of the following departments: Singapore Retail, South East Asia Intermediary, Regional Private Banking Business and/or Marketing. Please refer to the below key responsibilities in each of the departments: Singapore Retail and South East Asia Intermediary Business Tentative Internship Period: March - September 2022 Reporting into: Wholesale Director, SEA and SG Retail Key responsibilities of intern: Market Research and Analysis You will be tasked with a project to gather/update data and intelligence on the markets that we currently do business in such as Singapore, South East Asia and Regional Private Banks. After conducting research you will be required to analyse the data and make a recommendation to Fidelity International as to what more could we explore in these markets. You will also be required to make a formal presentation on your research and recommendation Through this project you will be able to gain an in-depth understanding our funds distribution business as well as learn valuable project management and presentation skills Sales and Customer Relationship Management You will assist the sales team across SEA, SG Retail and Private bank channels to position our funds, capabilities and service offerings and service our clients. You will work with the sales team to manage and enhance our customer relationship management system to enable Fidelity to gain a deeper understanding of our customers and to mine the data to generate more effective sales results You will have the opportunity to organize and participate in client roadshows, fund launches, events, seminars and industry events. Through these engagements, you will be able to observe the client interactions firsthand, and how each engagement is strategically tuned for optimal client impact. You'll also be able to gain sales pitching and client servicing skills. Strategic Initiatives and projects You will be involved in strategic initiatives that will help transform the business models for the Regional Private Banking, Singapore and SEA wholesale teams Projects upcoming in 2022 will include target operating model covering sales, sales support and client services; landscaping exercise for new capabilities (Fusion, Private Assets, ESG) and new channels (e.g. Digital banks, family offices). Transition of client reporting and events/campaigns to client relationship management system framework, corporate actions process and documentation and many more Through these projects you will be able to gain access to and learn to manage different stakeholders within the firm and pick up project management skills along the way Client Portfolio Strategist Tentative Internship Period: March - September 2022 Reporting into: Client Portfolio Strategist, Wholesale Key responsibilities of the intern: Content Production and Management You will work with the Product Strategist team to produce and maintain content for all our sales and product literature including product presentations, product placemats, product commentaries, thought leadership pieces and competitor analyses. You will also support in producing content for event presentations and coordinating with other stakeholders for investment and market content, product teach-ins, product feedback coordination etc. Through this experience you will be able to gain investment writing, product positioning and financial technical knowledge. South East Asia and Middle East Marketing Tentative Internship Period: July - December 2022 Reporting into: Head of Marketing SEA and MEA Key responsibilities of intern: Marketing: You will support the Southeast Asia and Middle East marketing team across a range of strategic and tactical marketing projects to champion the Fidelity brand and support business objectives. Project coverage will span from campaign development, event management to digital and social media marketing where you will have an opportunity to immerse yourself and learn. Through the stint, you will develop an appreciation for brand management, cultivate an eye for great copy and design, learn the basics of project management and be inspired by what great brands do. Who we look for We are looking for hungry and driven individuals who demonstrate strong ability to be proactive and think outside the box. We are also looking for people who are sociable and has high EQ, and be able to build ties with people from a range of business cultures and backgrounds. Confident and articulate, you should also have good analytical skills and technical knowledge on investments in general. Above all you'll be ready to soak up new sales and marketing ideas and concepts and take on whatever responsibility comes your way. Skills and Requirements: Student in the penultimate year of undergraduate or master's programme (Class of 2023 preferred) Strong interest in financial services industry Good academic performance Initiative and ability to work in a fast-paced environment Ability to multi-task Excellent level of written and verbal communication / presentation skills Proficiency in English and Chinese Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office applications Proactive and positive attitude, welcoming with enthusiasm new initiatives and learning opportunities Well-organised and attentive to details How to apply? Please submit your CV and cover letter through this link or careers.fidelityinternational.com by Sunday, 28 February 2022 . In your application, please state your reasons for applying to Fidelity International and our Summer Internship Programme and your preference of the department(s) you are interested in. For any enquiries in Asia Pacific, you can email us at We are committed to being an inclusive and diverse company to work for and strive to create a culture where flexible working is encouraged so that we retain and attract the best talent by offering working patterns that suit both individual and business needs.

Dealing with 'C-Level' stakeholders within target and existing clients Managing Sales Pipeline and Candidate/Client Data in an organized and structured format Manage/expand a client portfolio and be able to deliver monthly billing targets through pre-defined activity levels Strong business development capabilities to value add to the team and the business Engage in client meetings to foster deeper relationships Work efficiently and effectively on a daily basis to achieve maximum results Requirements: Graduate degree holder Experience in business development/sales/tele-sales Experience in pitching to 'C-Level' stakeholders Good interpersonal skills; a detailed and organized person who can work with "team" but also excel individually Ability to deal with high pressure and target-driven environment Must be able to take direction but also demonstrate initiative Has the drive and business acumen to take responsibility for your own business/desk and thrives on the opportunity Exceptional communication skills Perks & benefits: On offer is a very competitive base salary/commission scheme that begins at 10% and goes up to 35% (paid monthly) Attractive commission thresholds A very clear career path with promotions achieved through billings and performance Open plan and spacious working environment Award-winning in-house training through various programmes such as Learn to Lead & Learn to Leap Great platform to develop additional skills and more importantly ready yourself for that next promotion Weekly, monthly and annual incentives such as international holidays, Lunch Clubs, BBQ's, etc

Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH803888 Jan 17, 2022 Competitive Job Description Morgan McKinley is working in partnership with an European Corporate and Institutional Banking client with strong footprints and relationship in the APAC region. The Singapore team is looking for mutiple new headcounts in their KYC department to support the growth of their KYC checker team in Singapore. Reporting to the team leads, you will be assigned to either the Onboarding or Periodic Review team and be expected to provide your KYC expertise in the respective domains. Role and responsibilities To perform KYC due diligence of new relationships and existing clients (periodical revisions) for Hong Kong, Singapore, China, Malaysia, Australia, Taiwan and Japan entities as a Maker or Checker To conduct checks and due diligence on these clients primarily looking out for PEP/Adverse news/information that may be detrimental to the reputation of the bank To liaise and coordinate with Front Office and Client Services Team on the collection of the KYC documents/information To escalate complex cases to local Compliance and/or Head Office Financial Security for advice, clarification or validation where applicable To provide guidance and sharing of KYC knowledge to the junior team members in the team and other departments Inputting and Maintenance of the Static Data/Accounts of the Clients into the KYC Database Ensure accurate and proper maintenance of statistics for timely MIS reporting/other ad-hoc reports and perform monthly reconciliation on the KYC Status versus Opened Accounts of the Existing Clients (when required) To take part in Projects and perform UAT testing assigned by the Manager To perform ad-hoc screenings and other duties assigned by the Manager Key requirements Bachelor's Degree Holder in Banking & Finance or equivalent Minimum 2-3 years of experience in KYC / CDD, preferably in Corporate Investment Banking with a good understanding of AML/CFT Framework and KYC documentation processes Good understanding of the AML/KYC Regulatory Requirements in Asia (in particular HKMA, MAS, CBRC, PBOC, PRA, FSC and FSA) Strong verbal communication Strong Interpersonal skills with ability to effectively interact with cross functional teams and capable of working on own initiative and prioritizing work load Highly organized with excellent attention to detail, highly motivated and able to work with minimal supervision. Ability to multi-task and execute task with a sense of urgency and with ultimate goal of delivering tasks on time Strong Team player Good Knowledge with Excel will be an advantage If you are interested in the role and would like to discuss the opportunity further, please click apply now or email Hagen at ****@morganmckinley.com for more information. YOUR DAY TO DAY Development and implementation of Tealium’s Sales strategy in Asia, ensuring alignment with APJ and global operating best practices, localised and optimized for the SE & N Asia markets. You will report to the VP and GM of APJ (based in Sydney) and work closely with the functional APJ leaders across Marketing, Customer Success, Partnerships, and Solution Consulting. You will have extensive experience working in a global matrix organization and have a mature understanding of how to leverage global centers of excellence in the context of a local Asia operation. Working very closely with the Asia revenue teams (sales, SDR, marketing, CS) to position Tealium’s value and competitive differentiators and to ultimately win new customers who meet our Ideal Customer Profile. Tealium uses a Value Selling methodology to ensure we have a clear plan of how the deployment of our solution will quickly deliver quantifiable return on investment for our new customers. The RVP Sales Asia will be the local executive sponsor in all new sales cycles working closely with the team of Account Executives to define sales strategy, write and present value based proposals, and build strong relationships with senior executives. Tealium has a mature ecosystem of technology and service partners including AWS, Braze, Merkle, Meta, WPP Verticurl and Cap Gemini to name a few. As RVP Sales  you will build senior level relationships with our partners ensuring our joint business plans are aligned and delivering mutual value, and looking for new ways to optimize the mutual value of the relationship. You will ensure there is alignment with Tealium’s APJ and global partnership strategy looking for ways this can be leveraged in your region. Our Asia customers are proud of their investment in Tealium. As RVP Sales  you will work closely with the Asia Customer Success team creating meaningful senior executive relationships and guiding the overall direction of the relationship. Through your strong understanding of the local market and Tealium’s value, you will represent the needs of Asia’s customers in our roadmap and future strategy discussions, bringing Asia’s customers into the discussion so their ideas and feedback can be heard first hand. Being a brand ambassador for Tealium in Asia, you will present Tealium at industry events educating and inspiring companies by developing their digital transformation, customer experience, and 1st party data strategy. You will work closely with the Marketing team  to ensure our corporate marketing messages are effectively localised for the Asia market. Bring a strong positive cultural leadership style to help set the direction of Team Asia and keep the current team excited and engaged.

Job_Title: BILLING EXECUTIVE, REGISTRY SERVICES (2-year contract position)
Location: Supreme Court Lane, Downtown Core, Singapore, 179803, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description The Singapore Academy of Law (“SAL”) is a promotion and development agency for Singapore’s legal industry. Our vision is to make Singapore the legal hub of Asia. The Singapore Mediation Centre (“SMC”) is a subsidiary of the Academy. Established in 1997, SMC pioneered the use of mediation as the mainstream mechanism for dispute resolution, as well as training in negotiation and conflict management. Today, SMC offers a suite of alternative dispute resolution services which brings clarity and objectivity to complex situations. These services include mediation, adjudication, neutral evaluation and domain name dispute resolution. Through our panel of professional mediators with legal and industry expertise, SMC is well-placed to manage difficult negotiations and unlock standstills for businesses by providing cost-effective and timely solutions. At SMC, our vision is to help all businesses fully appreciate the value of mediation as a strategic risk-management tool that they can count on in commercial dealings. Responsibilities: You will support the administration of cases by managing the financial aspects of case files that are administered by SMC’s Registry team. This includes, but not limited to, SMC’s core services for Mediation and Adjudication. You will require familiarity with using SMC’s inhouse enterprise resource planning software – Business Central – to create customer cards, input data and generate invoicing (including e-invoicing) for case files. You will be required to liaise closely with the Finance department on invoicing, receipts, and other financial aspects between SMC’s Registry team and the Finance department. You may also be required to undertake other ad hoc duties in relation to the financial aspects of case files as and when required (e.g. collection and dispatch of cheques/documents). Requirements: Have familiarity with Business Central and MS Office. Be meticulous and organized, possess initiative, and are able to multitask to meet deadlines. Preferably have work experience related to Finance and/or Accounting. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Company Description About Bosch Group The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services, employing roughly 400,500 associates worldwide and generating sales of 78 billion euros in 2017 (preliminary figures). Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology.  As a leading IoT company, Bosch offers innovative solutions for smart homes, smart cities, connected mobility, and connected manufacturing.  It uses its expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as its own IoT cloud, to offer its customers connected, cross-domain solutions from a single source.  The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life.  Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm.  In short, Bosch creates technologies that is “Invented for life.” About Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group’s interests in Southeast Asia, where it is currently present in all ASEAN member countries. The company is active in all the company’s four business sectors of Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. The Asia Pacific headquarters for its Automotive Aftermarket, Building Technology and Bosch Software Innovations businesses, as well as operations for Corporate Research and Advance Engineering, and Information Technology, are part of Robert Bosch (SEA) Pte Ltd. In Bosch, we are committed through our EVP ensuring all our associates to GROW , ENJOY and INSPIRE on their journey with us. Job Description To sustain the fast and qualitative development progress in Bosch, we are seeking for a Senior Database Administrator for MS-SW to join our IT team in Singapore. In this role, you will be the subject matter expert of database structures, PowerBI setups and provide consultancy to customers and translates business needs into database/infrastructure requirements. You will create and deliver best-in-class database solutions that meets customer needs, coordinates and oversees installation of database solutions as needed. You will consults and supports the rollout of LIS (manufacturing plants) locations and creates and maintains documentation detailing technical design and processes. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or related area, or an equivalent combination of education, professional training and experience that provide the individual with the required knowledge, skills, and abilities. We require someone with at least 5 years of proven working experience in MSSQL Server Database Administration and software / database development experience.  You must have experience in Microsoft SQL 2012 to 2019 - installations, upgrades, and security patches, be competent in PowerBI, SSIS/SSRS/SSAS, Database infrastructure and architecture design, PowerShell scripting and database optimization and performance tuning. You must also be competent in Database HA setup, SQL Server Failover Cluster/AlwaysOn Availability Groups and experience with Performance Tuning and Optimization using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools. Some other key skills required for this role includes Backup/Recovery and Patching, Linux and Windows server experience, including Active Directory. You must be well verse in security hardening and CIS Compliance and able to work with peer DBAs and global teams located across the globe in different time zones. You must have great organizing skills with ability to  work independently and in teams. You must have ability to multi-task and context-switch effectively between different activities and teams and be familiarize with technical principles of disaster recovery and backup solutions, and data migration solutions of storage. Candidate with experience with Hybrid, Private or Private Cloud in Azure will be a great plus.

Are you looking for an opportunity to enhance your preventive maintenance and utility expertise within a cutting edge global environment? If so, this role could be an ideal opportunity to explore. As Senior/ Engineering Technician, you will be responsible to carry out preventive maintenance and repair all process and utility equipment. You will also be keeping all equipment in the best operating condition and minimizing equipment breakdown. This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career, these responsibilities include some of the following: Maintain and repair the defined plant equipment to maximize plant availability and minimize disruption to the production process. Operate, maintain and repair the defined utility system to ensure constant and reliable utility supply to the plant at all times so as to minimize disruption to the production process. Maintain the site equipment and facility to high GMP standard meeting the regulatory expectations such that the site is always inspection ready. Support implementation and execution of the Product Contamination Cause and Elimination (PCCE) program. Ensure all maintenance activities are carried out safely and good housekeeping is maintained. Carry out implementation activities for minor plant modifications and capital projects, in line with defined specifications and budget. Takes personal responsibility for quality in all aspects of maintenance work that will have impact on product quality. Initiate, encourage and implement Lean Sigma activities and implement JDI/CI projects that lead to reduce overall cost and improve cost effectiveness e.g. improve equipment reliability, standardization, etc. Ensure cost effectiveness of all maintenance jobs. • Maintain and repair the defined plant equipment to maximize plant availability and minimize disruption to the production process. Provides timely technical advice to other departments for troubleshooting / continuous improvements to processes / systems. Familiar with GSK Safety Procedures, Standard Operating Procedures, Good Engineering Practice, GMP to carry out maintenance activities to high quality standards. Support implementation of the GSK Production System (GPS) for Engineering Services. For Senior Technician - supervise and oversee 3rd party’s vendor/ in-house contractor’s maintenance and repair activities to ensure high quality and safety standard. Provide occasional shift coverage to minimize disruption to manufacturing. Why you? Basic Qualifications: We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals: A Nitec or diploma in Mechanical engineering, or any relevant engineering discipline 5 years and above working experience for Senior Technician, preferably from GMP background Candidate must be able to do heavy lifting as the role involves direct hands on with heavy equipment Must have hands on experience in preventive maintenance and equipment (e.g. identify equipment parts, do repairs and overhauls of equipment) Good knowledge in maintenance and operating principles of production and utility equipment Familiar with Computerized Maintenance Management System Able to adapt to fast paced manufacturing environment Effective communication skills Candidates without any prior working experience are encouraged to apply for junior positions Why GSK? At GSK, we have already delivered unprecedented change over the past four years, improving R&D, becoming a leader in Consumer Healthcare, strengthening our leadership, and transforming our commercial execution. Now, we’re making the most significant changes we’ve made to our business in over 20 years. We’re on track to separate and create two new companies in 2022: New GSK with a leading portfolio of vaccines and specialty medicines as well as R&D based on immune system and genetics science; and a new world-leading consumer healthcare company of loved and trusted brands. With new ambition comes new purpose. For New GSK, this is to unite science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together – all with the clear ambition of delivering human health impact; stronger and more sustainable shareholder returns; and as a new GSK where outstanding people thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it. How we do all this is through our people and our culture. A culture that is ambitious for patients – so we deliver what matters better and faster; accountable for impact – with clear ownership of goals and support to succeed; and where we do the right thing . So, if you’re ready to improve the lives of billions, join us at this exciting moment in our journey. Join our challenge to get Ahead Together. *This is a job description to aide in the job posting, but does not include all job evaluation details. Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing. Clifford Chance is the world's largest fully integrated law firm committed to leadership and innovation in legal service. It is a global market leader in all major areas of legal advice and a major element of its strategy is to attract and retain the best people by developing and nurturing the talent that they have. Clifford Chance is committed to delivering the highest levels of legal service.  We recognise that achieving this not only relates to the quality of our advice, but extends to the way in which we deliver our service, which is why our 'Innovation is Action' programme is a critical element of Firm strategy.  To support our partners in designing new approaches to matter delivery, we have built cross-functional virtual teams in key centres across the globe, comprising process improvement, project management, commercial management and technology skills sets. The role incumbent is responsible for: delivering improvement projects that change the way complex legal services are delivered to our clients; working with the colleagues from Technology, Continuous Improvement, Legal Project Management, Communications, Partnership Finance and Knowledge and Information to create and execute business transformation plans in your respective office or practice area; contributing to the Firm's innovation strategy; and taking ownership for various work streams that support that strategy. The success of this role will primarily be measured by: the achievement of the objectives set for the projects delivered; the extent to which improvement projects yield benefits to our clients and the Firm; and the successful roll-out of new ways of working across the globe. Key Accountabilities In this role, you will take direction from the Portfolio Manager to scope, plan and deliver prioritised projects that change the way legal services are delivered.  You will have responsibility for achieving stakeholder buy-in, for delivering projects within agreed timescales through to handover to "business as usual" and for ensuring that the agreed benefits are realised. You will be expected to work collaboratively with project team members from other Business Service departments and on occasion, coach them to deliver new solutions for delivering legal work to our clients. The projects will involve a diverse set of stakeholder groups and are likely to involve people from different departments in Business Services and may also involve lawyers and/or clients.  In this context, typical stakeholders include functional heads and other Directors, CXOs, Partners and senior representatives of client organisations. You will be expected to develop credible relationship with the partners and associates within the respective office or practice area to become a trusted and sought after advisor. You will be responsible for leading/guiding project teams and applying their experience to determine an optimal approach in complex and multi-dimensional environments.  You will be responsible for promoting team work and collaboration, ensuring prompt identification and resolution of potential areas of conflict, and for managing all aspects of change across a diverse set of stakeholder communities. Projects could be based in any geographic location and may involve multiple locations, in which case it is likely that some, or all, parts of the project will need to be managed remotely. You will run improvement workshops and seminars for clients and senior associates to help them understand how to adapt to the changing legal environment.  You will coach colleagues from other Business Service teams to deliver change projects of their own, including using technology, matter management approaches or process improvement. In order to transfer solutions effectively, you will deliver change, communication and training plans to the respective office or practice area that enable lawyers and partners to change the way they deliver their matters. You will facilitate workshops to design approaches for delivering specific matters that ensures appropriate use of the firms innovation capabilities that result in a world-class client experience.  The role has a requirement for some international travel and may require occasional weekend work (for example, if training courses are scheduled at weekends). Skills & Experience Professional Expertise Qualifications It is desirable that the role incumbent possess the following key skills for this role: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt.  They should be able to demonstrate a consistent level of skill at an appropriate level and a breadth of experience across medium to large projects.  Training in order to achieve Black Belt Certification may be available should the candidate not already have achieved this. The role incumbent would preferably be educated to degree level with a bachelor's degree or equivalent, ideally in a science or mathematics-based subject. Experience The role incumbent is likely to have worked in a professional services environment where they would have been involved in business transformation/process improvement training and projects.  The individual needs to have managed a number of projects from end-to-end.  They should have delivered revenue, cost and/or service results relating to set project objectives. Prior experience in process improvement is essential.  The role incumbent should have managed a number of improvement projects. Experience of working in a 'green-field' site and contributing to the roll-out and success of process improvement in an organisation would be advantageous. Experience of delivering training and/or mentoring, including the certification of other Continuous Improvement people in a process organisation, is preferable. Analytical Thought and Problem Solving Problems will most likely be varied in nature and the role incumbent should expect these to occur on a regular basis. This role requires the incumbent to take a consultative approach, which will involve a high level of creative thinking when seeking to understand, document and resolve problems, along with the ability to think laterally and innovatively if necessary.  The incumbent should be skilled in a number of different techniques to analyse problems and decompose them to their component parts in order to effectively communicate with the team members. This role incumbent will receive direction and support primarily from a Continuous Improvement Portfolio Manager as first point of escalation, but advice or assistance may also be sought from his or her colleagues in the team and a variety of other sources, e.g. business analysts, project managers, line managers and functional managers. Communicating & Influencing The role incumbent will need to have strong communications skills, providing a range of information and advice in a coherent manner and on a proactive basis.  The context may require the role incumbent to establish credibility by demonstrating an understanding of the audience's needs and the nature of the information being shared.  They should influence situations through the provision of information and advice on straightforward as well as more challenging issues, and will collaborate with other decision makers on day-to-day activities. The role incumbent will be required to have strong change management skills and awareness, with the ability to be able to understand and effect minimum disruption to the business.  This will involve the use of various techniques including communications, workshop facilitation, planning and training. Leadership The role incumbent will be required to set the vision/strategy for their projects, whilst demonstrating a strong customer focus through clear recognition and understanding of the clients and their requirements at all times. The role incumbent is required to have a sound understanding of business analysis and project management best practice, tools and techniques.  This will involve an element of leading by example and may require some development of team members in order to ensure project success.  The role incumbent is likely to work with teams that vary in relation to the complexity, size and scope of the project.  These teams will usually comprise of a number of specialists (including, where relevant, lawyers) from different functions. The role will involve interaction with other teams, across different functions and/or businesses.  Interaction with clients and/or others in third party organisations may also be required. The role incumbent will be required to support other people in applying the tools and principles of Continuous Improvement, such as Green Belts. Organisational/Strategic thinking The role incumbent's decisions and actions can impact a number of colleagues and/or internal clients with results being known in the short term.  The impact affects a number of operational and financial parameters. Managing Resources The role incumbent will have no formal line management responsibilities initially.  They will be responsible for their own work and will provide advice, guidance, training and/or mentoring to others as required.  They will also be required to request the use of resources from other departments, offices, vendors and suppliers for part or whole delivery. The role incumbent may be required to plan, prioritise and allocate resources within work/project teams to achieve agreed results within agreed timescales. Making Decisions The role incumbent makes decisions on matters to do with their own work and that of others in the team such as allocating tasks, scheduling work, etc.  They will have the support and guidance from a Continuous Improvement Portfolio Manager to help them achieve this.  Work is generally guided by a range of policies, procedures and precedents.  The role incumbent uses discretion to tailor work practices to achieve the desired results.  However, decisions that are likely to impact or change these parameters will have to be agreed with the relevant stakeholders. Client Focus At Clifford Chance, we believe in bringing the client - both internal and external - to the centre of everything we do. To do this we need to understand, anticipate and fulfill the unique needs and expectations of each client.  We call this "Client Focus" and to help deliver this core part of our business strategy, we want to recruit people who not only excel in their field but who are also client focused. We are looking for people who: •            Can demonstrate a keen interest and enthusiasm to understand their clients' priorities; •            Are self-starters but also team players ready to help others and contribute to the overall success; •            Listen, question and deliver; and •            Are reliable and responsive, who can put the needs of the client first. In short, we are looking for people who are motivated by client satisfaction and who strive to exceed the expectations of their clients. Working at Clifford Chance & About the Firm From your first day with us, you will have varied opportunities to continuously grow and develop your skills and knowledge. From formal training, informal coaching and mentoring through to skillls-based and technical training and on the job learning. Whatever your area of expertise, you will find a range of career opportunities at Clifford Chance. And wherever you're heading, Clifford Chance is where you can be true to your ambitions. Our firm, work and people span jurisdictions, cultures and languages. In a world where commercial success increasingly relies on globalization, we offer clients a truly international perspective, and we offer our people a rewarding and stimulating career. We're proud of our approachable, friendly and team-based way of working. Highly professional and self-assured, with an entrepreneurial streak, our people are more than happy to share their expertise and knowledge. Equal Opportunities At Clifford Chance we understand that our true asset is our people. Inclusion is good for our team and their families, our firm and society. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants fairly and equally regardless of their gender, gender identity and expression, marital or civil partnership status, race, colour, national or ethnic origin, social or economic background, disability, religious belief, sexual orientation, or age.  This applies to recruitment and selection, terms and conditions of employment including pay, promotion, training, transfer and every other aspect of employment. Our goal is to deliver an equality of opportunity, an equality of aspiration and an equality of experience to everyone who works in our firm. Find out more here. Our Recruitment Process Our recruitment process is straightforward. It is aimed to be a two-way conversation that will allow you to learn more about the role and the firm, and will be a chance for us to chat to you about your experience and assess your capabilities for the role. All vacancies in Singapore are advertised in one place, on our careers portal. To apply online you will need an up-to-date CV. If you meet the criteria for the role, the partners or hiring manager will review your CV before a decision is taken about the next steps. If you are unsuccessful at this stage, you will receive an email from one of our team. If you are invited for a face-to-face interview these take place at our offices or via video conference. Typically, you will meet with two people in the first stage, and another two people in the second stage. Your interviewers are usually the hiring manager or hiring partner, senior team members and a member of the HR team. You will meet people who you will be working with should you be successful. For some roles we may ask you to complete a case study or prepare a presentation related to the role you are interviewing for. If you get an offer from the firm, you'll be called by your HR contact who will lay out the offer terms, and an offer pack will be sent to you. If you have any questions during the recruitment process, please contact the team directly.

Summary The Firm has a pioneering history in providing solutions that help our clients manage risk and highly complex issues in the smartest and most efficient way possible. The Innovation & Best Delivery Programme has grown substantially over the past few years through the three strands of Create R&D, Applied Solutions and Best Delivery: Best Delivery ensures that we can deliver an outstanding client experience on every matter, every time. Our application of continuous improvement principles, legal project management, smart technology and the most efficient and effective resources are all geared to improving outcomes for our clients' business. Clifford Chance Applied Solutions is our team dedicated to providing customer care and maintenance for the digital solutions we sell to clients and includes sales and marketing support. Create focuses on joining forces with clients, industry innovators, breakthrough technologists and established market players to explore new technologies, business models and ways of working to stay at the forefront of the developments that shape the sector and the Firm's future client service model. The Create Research & Development (Create R&D) Hub is a team dedicated to the rapid and effective selection, design and development of digital solutions and products for our lawyers and our clients.  It includes research, design, project management and development expertise supporting the global firm and its clients. The role incumbent is responsible for supporting the firm's global Create R&D Hub n with a primary focus on the coordination of the firm's Singapore-based Innovation Lab (Create+65) activities. Role Description Reporting to the Innovation Lead, Create+65 the role will have a dual function supporting both global and local initiatives.  This includes responsibility for: Create R&D Function Supporting the triage of new ideas for the Innovation & Best Delivery Programme globally through competitive intelligence and market research and analysis Supporting the external profile of the firm's innovation expertise through marketing activities including blog and social media posts, conference collaboration and presentations Create Innovation Lab (Create+65) Supporting the development of new opportunities and ideas for the Innovation & Best Delivery programme locally through research and analysis Being involved in client presentations and collaboration projects in Asia Pacific to share our innovation strategy and initiatives and to help identify new opportunities for product development and client engagement Being involved in representing Create when presenting to or collaborating with other parties in the Asia Pacific market (including universities, incubators, and other ecosystem partners such as SOLIA) Driving the promotion and engagement with the Innovation & Best Delivery Programme through knowledge sharing and delivery of training and other presentations internally to lawyers and business services professionals in APAC offices. You will be expected to work collaboratively with project team members from other Business Service departments and to develop credible relationships with the partners and associates within the respective office. Projects could be based in any geographic location and may involve multiple locations, in which case it is likely that some parts of the project will need to be managed remotely. There may be some limited international travel. Skills and Experience Qualifications The role incumbent will preferably be educated to degree level with a bachelor's degree or equivalent. Professional Experience The role incumbent is likely to have worked in a professional services environment where he/she would have been involved in the rollout of new initiatives. Experience of working in a 'green-field' site would be advantageous. Entrepreneurial Ideally the role incumbent will have an entrepreneurial spirit and flexible approach to get involved in all aspects of the innovation team delivery. They will be good at identifying problems that need to be solved, seeing new opportunities and defining and executing plans. Analytical and Creative Thought This role requires the incumbent to take a consultative approach, which will involve a high level of creative thinking alongside a can-do attitude. The incumbent will be able to demonstrate strong skills/ experience in analysing and synthesising information. This role incumbent will receive direction and support primarily from the Global Lead, Clifford Chance & Innovation as first point of escalation, but advice or assistance may also be sought from a variety of other sources, such as expert lawyers and the marketing and business development team. Research The role incumbent will have strong research skills and will enjoy presenting their findings to colleagues in written or verbal form. We are therefore committed to treating all employees and job applicants fairly and equally regardless of their gender, gender identity and expression, marital or civil partnership status, race, colour, national or ethnic origin, social or economic background, disability, religious belief, sexual orientation, or age.  This applies to recruitment and selection, terms and conditions of employment including pay, promotion, training, transfer and every other aspect of employment. Groundup.ai aims to empower every workplace to be an AI-driven company. We envision that our clients will be using our AI tools as a base in their everyday lives. As we continue bringing our innovative approach to our fast-growing companies to create an impact in the world, we are looking for hungry and passionate IOT Engineering Interns to join us on our exciting journey. This means that you will be involved in the development of ground-breaking solutions and products for some of the largest companies in the world, ranging from manufacturing, aerospace, logistics, and maritime. As a member of our engineering team, you will work in a fast-paced environment with a talented and international group of experts to create, enhance and support state-of-the-art industrial AI applications for our customers. The work you do will be a highly varied and challenging mix of new feature development, new product development, and application maintenance. We value team members who execute ideas with gusto and have an insatiable appetite to win. Groundup.ai has been able to achieve market leadership positions in industries we are involved in and we are able to prove our concepts rapidly. After all, we live only once and we make the best out of it. Our business units have gone on to win multiple prestigious awards and recognitions from government bodies and esteemed organizations. If you are interested in joining this dynamic and creative team in this journey, we would love to speak with you. Roles & Responsibilities / Scope of Works: - Work closely with the Tech team to integrate data collection and transmission software with Instrumentation & Control systems - Provides solutions, deployment, and provisioning of Edge devices - Solutioning and provisioning of Edge devices connectivity to the Cloud - Integrate sensors and image capture for remote transmission/submission to APIs - Performs data validation against sensor readings - Iterate on past versions of data monitoring solutions - Visualise data in a user-friendly format, to enable monitoring and decision making by customers and internal stakeholders - Provide proper project and engineering documentation Requirements & Qualifications / Preferred Skills: - Candidates pursuing a Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or other related disciplines. - Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills - Strong interest in IoT and IT industrial protocols - Basic soldering skills. - Basic knowledge in 3D printing - Knowledge and understanding of electrical hardware and processes such as, but not limited to, Raspberry Pi, Arduino, ESP32 / 8266 - Making proper connections on the above devices; eg. connecting VCC / GND / Data to respective pins. - Understanding Network Communications protocols, such as Modbus, Amazon Web Services; other managed cloud services is a plus. - Strong interest in edge or fog computing - Strong interest in networking setups (DNS, DHCP, Firewall, Gateways, Routers) - Strong interest in OT protocols (Modbus RTU, Modbus TCP, IEC 104) - Strong interest in IoT protocols (MQTT, AMQP, CoAP) - Excellent interpersonal skills. - Able to operate individually and as part of an agile team; effectively set expectations, manage work, and deliver results Application procedures

Established in 2020, the Singapore Studio is Riot’s second international game development studio. Working together with our Hong Kong Studio, Riot has been expanding our footprint in Asia and accelerating our talent growth to develop games that deliver great experiences to our players. Our mission is to “scale Riot’s games to hyper-serve players.” We partner with our LA headquarters on game development for League of Legends, Teamfight Tactics, and Legends of Runeterra. We’re also building teams for VALORANT and Project L, our take on a fighting game. The Singapore Studio is seeking talented, passionate Rioters with backgrounds in all areas of game development to build games that make it better to be a player. We’re focused on working together to promote individual autonomy, ownership, collaboration, and inclusivity, so every Rioter can be their best while we boldly pursue games. That's where you come in At Riot, we believe “Quality Assurance” is more than the bug-finding process that follows months of development work. For us, it’s a set of values, practices, and behaviours that inform every part of the development process. Riot QA assists our engineers, artists, and designers to realise their best work, and the best way to work. Through iteration and fast cycles, we refine our choices and identify process and product defects early, thus protecting the player from flaws and distractions. This great opportunity challenges us to rethink our approach to achieve the very best for our players. We help Riot sustainably craft excellent experiences for our players, globally. VALORANT is Riot’s take on a character-based tactical shooter (for more info on VALORANT click here!). As an experienced QA Engineer II you'll lead quality efforts for VALORANT and provide testing support for a product team working across VALORANT features to provide value to millions of players. You'll join a multi-discipline team of developers and designers on a mission to improve the player experience. You can use your experience in QA within game development to build a player quality strategy. Responsibilities As QA Engineer II for League of Legends you will be key in supporting your development teams, Engineers and Artists, executing and owning the QA process to deliver quality to Players. You will be improving and refining efficient solutions to problems, while continuously improving delivery. Establishing best quality practices that help ship great experiences for Players is a key expectation for this role. You will drive accountability for overall quality, as an essential factor for decision making across product leadership. Establishing metrics that matter, using data to guide action. Communications driven, representing the QA teams work on progress, tasks or blockers and the overall Quality of the assigned product. Required Qualifications: 4+ years of experience, leading Quality efforts in game development You have (functionally) led a team of QA's (Inhouse or outsourced) You have successfully grown a culture of quality across game teams and game products You have shown Continuous improvement of your product, discipline and craft Experience working with remote development and test teams Experience in applying your expertise to solve systemic problems Experience working with test automation and tools strategy Desired Qualifications: ISTQB qualifications; i.e.: Agile Tester/Expert lvl/Adv. Test Mgr. SCRUM/Agile qualifications Development/Test experience across several platforms; Mobile, Console, PC For this role, you'll find success through craft expertise, a collaborative spirit, and decision-making that prioritizes the delight of players. We will look at your past studies, experience, and your personal relationship with games. If you embody player empathy and care about the experiences of players, this could be the role for you! Our Perks: Full relocation support Full health insurance for you, your spouse and children Open paid time off Retirement benefits with company matching Life insurance, parental leave, plus short-term and long-term disability

Crypto.com was founded in 2016 on a simple belief: it’s a basic human right for everyone to control their money, data and identity. With over 10+ million users on its platform today, Crypto.com provides a powerful alternative to traditional financial services, turning its vision of “cryptocurrency in every wallet” into reality, one customer at a time. Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security, privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have ISO27001:2013 and PCI:DSS 3.2.1, Level compliance. Crypto.com is headquartered in Singapore with a 3000+ strong team. For more information, please visit www.crypto.com. About the Role As Product Operations Manager for Crypto.com, you will help expand the company’s product offerings in the most optimized way possible. You will lead new initiatives and collaborate with teams from different functional areas to allow our products to execute efficiently. In addition, you will help operationalize our products, achieve operational excellence, and provide oversight of the team’s daily operations. Responsibilities Work with Product Managers to operationalize (create process and plan to execute and operate globally 24/7) new products/features to scale. Swiftly gather information and analyze the situation to advise recommendations. Facilitate and influence senior management decision making and accurately lead the outcome delivery. Establish operational best practices to drive efficiency enhancements letting the company capture market tractions timeously. Partner with product managers and senior management to derive operations priorities and execution plans. Nurture a team culture of high performance and continuous improvement. Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience. 5+ years of experience in Management Consulting, Product Management, Operations, and/or Finance/Investment Banking/Venture Capital. Experience in leading operational expansion to multi-geographies. Knowledgeable in operational system implementation and process re-engineering. Strong business acumen with exceptional problem solving and analytical skills. Understanding the crypto industry will be advantageous. Fluency in English. Cantonese and Mandarin will be big pluses. Benefits We offer an attractive compensation package working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech. Huge responsibilities from Day 1. Be the owner of your own learning curve. Hello, and welcome to Hugo! Hugo is an Integrated Financial Super App that exists to bring financial wellbeing to everybody. We take our #hugoheroes on a financial journey where they spend, save and invest more effectively. By developing healthy and life-changing financial habits, we are building financially healthy and thriving communities. Hugo is not just a product but also a philosophy that will evolve and grow with its #HugoHeroes i.e. our customers, partners and people. Our initial market is Singapore but regional and global expansion will follow swiftly. Hugo is a brand owned and operated by Atlas Consolidated Pte Ltd. Who we are looking for and why We are a hungry and driven team who are looking for an exceptional person to join us in fulfilling our mission. We are looking for an experienced Head of Operations to lead the Operations Team and work alongside the Executive Management Team. We need to continue to define, build and implement our operations strategy, architecture. What a “Head of Operations” means to us Someone who designs and implements comprehensive operations strategies ensuring compliance with local and international regulations, oversees operational frameworks like treasury, payments both card and banking, customer service, technology service delivery and drives live operations for the company’s business activities. The Company depends on the Head of Operations to drive the operations strategy, and provide leadership to the operations team, which includes Operations, Treasury and Customer Support. Extensive knowledge in card payments, bank payment processing and reconciliation and excellence in customer service and care is a prerequisite for this role. Additional responsibilities will include oversight of our investment products putting in place cash management, settlement and reconciliation. Do not worry if your experience does not extend to securities industry - as this is an extension of standard account of records management and the team has extensive experience in this sector. Requirements How you can help us There are certain functions and capabilities we believe are essential to the role: Proven experience and success across the various disciplines of operations, specifically in debit (and credit) card payments, domestic banking and SWIFT payments - ideally within B2C e-wallet, FX and payment services sector; Ability to develop our Operations and Treasury strategy, in alignment with strategic business objectives - being hands on with building and optimising processes; Responsibility for building, training and developing a team which can scale across SE Asia, using cross functional training; Responsibility for implementation of robust internal controls to ensure risk management in the day-to-day running of the Treasury and Operation team, which mitigates errors through fostering a dialogue of ‘openness, honesty and transparency’; Treasury Management - including debit cards, cash, FX and physical gold of customer and operational accounts, ensuring timely payment processing, confirmation and reconciliation; Debit Card Issuing program and operational management - working with card networks, eg VISA, Mastercard, China Union Pay etc to ensure operational adherence on network rules and guidelines, complete with knowledge of card settlement processes - fees, refunds and chargebacks; Work closely with the finance controller to ensure operational, third party payments, and aggregated customer accounts net balance to zero each day and meet the regulatory reporting schedules of the relevant regulatory bodies by country, notably on meeting strict capital buffer requirements for the customer balances; Previous experience with creating operational flows, suggesting product improvements and working on onboarding flows to provide seamless customer experience; Work with the Compliance, Product and Technology teams to implement automated solutions for primarily for operations, compliance, customer onboarding and support; Play a lead role in maintenance of quality assurance processes and implement streamlined processes for customers; Develop and manage vendor relationships, their contracts and negotiate commercial terms; Experience working with an ASEAN based product market; Combining market research with a data driven analytical approach to drive the strategy, understand the value proposition, set goals and demonstrate ROI; Creating competitor and market analysis, staying ahead of trends and competitor positioning; Working with the Management Team to set budgets; Working closely with Product, Data, Customer Support and Management in delivering a better experience for Hugo customers; Create a solid network of strategic partnerships; Propagating our purpose, mission, vision and values. What we would consider as added value Skills and capabilities we believe are highly relevant include: 8+ years of proven experience in a lead/senior operations role; Bachelors/Masters degree or equivalent in a relevant subject area; Multidisciplinary experience within multiple operational roles in financial services or fintech; Potential experience with Card networks on acquiring side; Experience with consumer asset management operations, equity, bonds and FX; Strong knowledge of South East Asian markets (particularly Singapore); Passionate about joining an early stage Fintech; Ability to identify, build and enhance key relationships, influence and challenge as required; Superior time management and very organized with excellent interpersonal and presentation skills; Fluent English speaker and writer, ideally with local language skills – Indonesian, Mandarin. Performance indicators to get you off to a great start A touch down quick win (30 Days): Acclimatise with our Operations team and rapidly come up to speed with our existing SOGs. Maintain and develop relationships with all our key third party providers. Understand team members roles and responsibilities to begin assessment of Operations, Treasury and Customer Support functions. Found your feet (90 Days): Assess how we can improve and optimise Operational functions so we can create highly efficient teams. Work with founders and the team to define what is a best-in-class operations team - we believe this is a function of Operational Technology, well-defined processes and suitable internal controls which enable efficient delivery. Further develop ORM procedures and standards to ensure continued cultural awareness of operational, compliance and business risk. Develop a robust business continuity plan to be updated based on the growth of the company and annually. Set a budget for expansion in conjunction with the executive team based on your ‘best-in-class’ assessment. Well into your stride (180 Days): Ensure we implement and develop Operational Technology systems to improve operational efficiencies - automation and cost benefits. Ensure including cross-functional training of your growing team. Work closely with founders and compliance team on regional country opening needs. Benefits Can accommodate flexi-working schedules Hugo Values being Responsible, Open and Collaborative We are responsible to our customers, community and team to help shape a more open, collaborative approach to money. This is the way Hugo hopes to make a difference; help us build better communities. Shared responsibility is not only part of our approach to money but a key part of how we work together. This shared responsibility allows for openness and candour between us as a team and in our relationship with our customers. Good ideas can come from anywhere, so an open and collaborative dialogue between the Hugo community (customers, the team, the stakeholders, alike) helps get the best from us all and helps make the difference. Everyone is welcome to apply

Location: Jtc Launchpad @ One-North, Queenstown, Singapore, Central Region
Job_Descriptions: Job Description We are looking to host solution-minded student to embark their internship journey with us. Here’s your chance to create a journey with us. Come join our medical start-up. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is a medical start-up developing an advanced machine vision tracking system for the management of Overactive Bladder (OAB). Our goal is to design and develop a proprietary diagnostic tool to analyze real-time images of the bladder. The diagnostic tool will help pinpoint unusual muscle group activity to help in the treatment of OAB. We need passionate and flexible engineers to grow with us. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is incubated by Trendlines Medical Singapore Pte Ltd. Project Name: Deep-Learning architecture development involving 2D and 1D vascular datasets such as specklegram / photoplethysmogram biosignals for polymorphic determination in cardiometabolic diseases Background: Worldwide, a third of adults suffer from some form of Cardiovascular disease (CVD) which annually contribute to the deaths of 17.7 million people globally, accounting for 31% of total deaths. In comparison, the combined annual deaths resulting from HIV/Aids, malaria, and tuberculosis combined only amount to 3.86 million. Hypertension affects at least 25% of the global adult population and is the most common cause of CVD-related deaths due to associated secondary pathologies. There is also a significant association of hypertension with type 2 diabetes mellitus (DM) with hypertension being twice as frequent in diabetic sufferers compared to non-diabetics. By 2050, Singapore projects that there will be 1 million sufferers of diabetes, accounting for 10% of the disease burden in Singapore. Disease prediction solely from genotyping has resulted in poor associations due to unexpected multi-nomic interactions. Scope: This project proposal seeks to apply advanced Machine Learning (ML) or Deep Learning (DL) algorithms on 1D/2D datasets to identify potential pleiotropic relationships in cardiometabolic diseases. We will also evaluate the predictive performance and accuracy of various AI-ML algorithms. The objective is to develop an advanced Artificial Intelligence (AI) architecture extracting critical features from the pulsatile morphology of 1-Dimensional PPG signals or 2D vascular videos to form an adaptive numerical model of an individual. Due difficulty in acquiring real-world biosignal datasets, novel techniques will need to be implemented to address the limited data available for training such as autonomous semi-supervised neural network designs. The project will involve 1D/2D signal processing and deep learning and will require strong knowledge in Python programming. Application Deadline: 1 May 2022 Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends

Role Digital Infrastructure Consultant Reports to Digital Infrastructure Practice Lead Overview Our working environments are constantly evolving and our clients are looking for engaging, exciting and human experiences in the workplace. Tech is the foundation. As a tech design consultancy at the vanguard of design for prestigious, household name clients, PTS delights in achieving their objectives through the design and delivery of tech experiences. You will gain invaluable experience in tech, the built environment, and personal growth through executing unique, future-looking tasks involving AI, IoT, machine learning, and multiple industries including the cutting edge of edu-and-med-tech. Based in our Singapore office in the CBD, you will be working on cutting edge projects for prestigious, household name clients with one common goal – to be the number one design consultancy in Asia for workplace experiences underpinned by tech. Don’t worry if you lack experience in this area, we will provide training. Our key consideration is the right attitude and a confident personality that can communicate effectively. PTS is an Equal Opportunities employer and applicants are selected solely on the basis of their relevant aptitudes, skills and abilities. No applicant shall receive less favorable treatment on the grounds of sex, marital status, civil partnership status, trans-gender status, pregnancy, maternity, color, race, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, belief, sexual orientation, disability, age. This is not an exclusive list. Responsibilities Our consultants are responsible for providing professional services to PTS’ clients throughout strategy, design, procurement and implementation stages of projects. Overview of Role: To perform the role of Consultant - for the PTS Digital Infrastructure (DI) Practice: · Working as part of a multi-skilled team to provide structured cabling and telecoms design services to PTS’ clients · Convert client requirements from concept design to fully functional solutions · Manage the tendering process and quality assure installations · Represent PTS in a professional manner at all times and exercise good communication skills with the Client; other design bodies and contractors The Digital Infrastructure Consultant will be responsible for: · Assisting the Practice Lead with project delivery, strategy and market direction to develop the practice · Defining the business needs of clients and accordingly formulating the technology requirements of organizations into written strategies · Supporting the Practice Lead in presenting and justifying the strategy to technical, non-technical and CX-level clients · Supporting the Digital Infrastructure Practice Lead in managing and defining processes for competitive procurement including: o Assisting with proposals and sales presentations o Evaluating and analyzing responses o Vendor management · Supporting the Practice Lead in establishing and refining the service delivery processes · Develop partner & consortium relationships Description of Duties · To provide IT Infrastructure consultancy with any design works, including but not limited to: proposals, schematics, budgetary information, tender documentation, project management including design coordination with other designers to establish integrated solutions · To provide design across the various IT Infrastructure platforms · Manage an IT Infrastructure project end-to-end; from initiation, requirements gathering, concept and detailed designs, procurement including management of RFPs, vendor interview and selection, project coordination during construction periods including representation during construction meetings and reporting, through to testing & commissioning and user acceptance training · Create or contribute to related PTS tender responses · Increase business opportunities through various routes to market · Understand the local and global IT Infrastructure delivery capability of PTS · Understand and report market conditions and competitor activity · Maintain a self-development program · Represent PTS to the public, key stakeholders, executive management, business partners and clients · Provide weekly project status updates · Ensure PTS’ adherence to the agreed scope of works raising and tracking change requests · Ensure that technical skills are kept up-to-date and continually improved · Ensure proper time recording In addition to delivery responsibilities, the Digital Infrastructure Consultant is expected to: · Have strong organizational and communication skills · Project manage a team of consultants or vendors across multiple technology disciplines · Have excellent interpersonal skills · Be able to command and empathize with both internal and client teams · Manage multiple simultaneous assignments and clients · Collaborate with other PTS teams (AV, physical security, Professional and Managed Services) and service lines so that a united PTS can provide a complete IP-based intelligent building proposition Our consultants are responsible for providing professional services to PTS’ clients throughout strategy, design, procurement and implementation stages of projects.
