About Doctor Anywhere Doctor Anywhere (DA) is on a mission to be the largest tech-enabled, omnichannel healthcare provider in Southeast Asia. First launched in Singapore in 2017, DA aims to bridge gaps in the healthcare ecosystem through developing innovative solutions and technologies. In 2021, DA raised SGD$88 million in Series C fundraising (August 2021) and acquired Doctor Raksa, the biggest telemedicine platform in Thailand which further strengthened our foundation for telehealth and healthcare offerings. Today, DA is present in Malaysia, Thailand, Philippines, Vietnam, Indonesia and India, serving more than 2.5 million (and growing) users across the region. At DA, we believe in the value of innovation and collaboration. Grounded in our motto of “Keep Going, Keep Growing”, our team strives towards excellence every day, and values diversity in perspectives brought by every member. Together, we bring quality healthcare to your doorstep! About the team The Data team within Doctor Anywhere oversees all of the company’s data-related requirements. The goal is to use the data to assist the company in making product/business decisions, and measure its effectiveness. This team works closely with our Product, Engineering, Business to develop a deep understanding of how our products are used and influence the company strategy. This role reports directly to the Head of Data . About the role We are seeking an enthusiastic and self-motivated Business Intelligence Analyst to manage our data, building a well structured data warehouse, developing reports, and transforming business needs into data models and data visualizations to help everyone in the organization make decisions efficiently. You enjoy working in a cross-functional environment, collaborating with Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Product Managers, Engineering Teams and Business Stakeholders, providing clean and well structured data to the organization. Automate and validate newly created reports and develop corrective actions to improve data integrity and quality. Work closely with Business (Product/Marketing/Operations etc. departments) and the other data functions (data engineers, data analysts, and data scientists) to analyse business requirements and transform them to solutions (data warehouse design, ETL, data visualization, and reports). Develop reports or dashboards to increase revenue, improve and reduce manual procedures. Empower a certain group of stakeholders so that they can be independent in using the BI tool. Managing access to the data source that are published in the BI tool About you Degree in Computer Science/Business/Statistics/Management/Economics/Mathematics with minimally 3 years of Business Intelligence/Analytics/Statistics and/or reporting experience. Strong SQL development skills desired, writing complex queries and testable. Analytical mind and business acumen with ability to work with large amounts of data to design data model and structure that is friendly to use for decision making. Working experience with data visualisations and tools, preferably Tableau. Quick learner and proven ability to handle multiple projects concurrently. Team player with an ability to function effectively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Has the experience writing a readable code with Python will be added advantage. A start-up attitude - you take full ownership of things that you do, willing to go out of your comfort zones and take on new challenges. Comfortable with ambiguity and flexible to learn new things - we’re not done growing, and heading into uncharted territories is part of the fun! Not for you? We have other opportunities that may interest you or someone you know. Feel free to visit us at our careers page - https://doctoranywhere.com/job-listing/ for more information.

Job_Title: Marketing/Business Development Intern (Job Ref Key: MAR2022MBDI)
Job_Descriptions: National is… A local freight-forwarding SME A specialist in moving ship spares Located in Changi Airfreight Centre What do we need help with? Thirty years is a laudably long time to be in business but National acknowledges that to last another thirty years and more, change and innovation are inevitable. What better way to do this than to involve young and fresh minds from the age of digitalisation itself? The role will entail… Working closely with our sales executives Critiquing, enhancing and maintaining current and new promotional channels (e.g. website, social media, EDM) Analysing existing customer pipeline (i.e. boost satisfaction and loyalty) and generating new sales leads Reviewing current work processes and establishing methods to streamline them/make them more efficient Conducting market research (on competitor analysis, new business opportunities, emerging technologies, etc.) Subject to discussion with mentor, in-office/WFH blended approach Adhoc visits to/on customers’ offices in town, warehouses/vessels/ports in the west, truck drives around the island Some interaction with and job-shadowing of the MD We are looking for an undergrad who is... Open to learn about the industry Inquisitive and not afraid to clarify doubts Eager to share opinions and suggest improvements Motivated by the freedom to initiate change Driven enough to put words into action Enjoys meeting and interacting with people from various walks of life Savvy with social media and technology Familiar with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel or willing to learn What you might like about National: We hail from the exciting industry of shipping. (Yes, we’re one of those who actually think that shipping is cool! While it may not be incredibly glamorous, it is omnipresent and never sleeps. Just look around you – almost everything has been shipped!) We have thirty years of experience and knowledge that we’re raring to share with the younger generation. Comprising of roughly 50, our team is a relatively cosy one. Everyone talks to everyone and everyone learns from everyone. Nobody is a stranger. The famous Changi Village Hawker Centre is just a stone’s throw away. How about that for lunch? We’re located literally by the beach. You can’t miss the planes, the sea view or the sea breeze.

Job_Descriptions: The Dean for Academic Services is a leader and champion in the areas of academic quality, curricular innovation, assessment, accreditation and compliance. The Dean for Academic Services will provide the leadership and oversight at the institutional level for all academic services – which refers to all activities involving the creation, maintenance, revision, and continuous improvement of academic processes and support systems to produce the desired student and graduate outcomes for all courses and programmes offered within Kaplan Singapore. The Dean for Academic Services is also responsible for overseeing student admissions, retention and progression efforts institution-wide. The Dean for Academic Services will work closely with the Dean for Academic Partnership to manage all components of the institution’s quality systems/accreditation/licensure requirements as an integrated whole to achieve continual positive outcomes. Responsibilities Advocate for and support the development of innovative curriculum and programmes. Provide leadership and oversight to ensure academic integrity and compliance with policies and regulations for all student admissions, progression, assessment and accreditation activities in the institution. Implement policies and ensure operations are aligned with the mission, vision, values, and institutional goals, and objectives. Lead faculty and staff in the development, implementation, and evaluation of programmes to support student success. Lead faculty and staff in the development, implementation, and evaluation of student engagement experiences (e.g., clinical and field experiences) where feasible and appropriate. Plan, implement and evaluate short and long term strategies to optimise organisational effectiveness and efficiency including initiatives to improve work processes and faculty and staff performances in the academic services areas. Work closely with faculty and student support staff to gather, interpret and present data on students, student progress, and student success indicators in order to enhance instructional effectiveness and support enrolment efforts. Work with faculty and staff to promote the development of alternative delivery formats (e.g., on-line, hybrid, off-campus) for courses and programmes. Location: Funan, 107, North Bridge Road, Downtown Core, Singapore, 179105, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description At Paragon, we are much more than just a karate school, a sport, or a fun activity. We are a family that creates Superheroes. Our Australian School is growing, and we are looking for young, energetic, enthusiastic and passionate individuals to join us as we expand into Singapore. We teach our students that they can positively influence the world by focusing on their behaviour. Through our innovative programs, each of our students learns to unleash their inner Superhero to become the best version of themselves that they can be. At Paragon, we aim to make each class a positive, rewarding and motivating experience. We are a family school with a friendly, inclusive and welcoming community, providing exceptional karate training to students of all ages, backgrounds, and abilities. Regardless of ability, we believe that any person should be given the opportunity to participate fully, and our programs are designed to ensure this. ParagonInc Singapore's expansion has the primary objective of opening a SuperHero School in Singapore focused on a Martial Arts program for children aged 5-11. In addition, we will expand into teenager, adults, and pre-school aged children post the initial launch. We are looking for instructors to join us on this journey from the beginning! The offer: We are holding a comprehensive selection activity starting March 1st 2022, for two months. 8-10 candidates will be selected to join this selection activity. Candidates will receive two months of free training to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts. Following this, we will select 3-4 instructors for paid positions. - Join two months of free lessons (twice a week) to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts (March 1st to April 30th). - After two months, the head instructor will select Instructors to become part of the Paragon Instructor Team in a paid position. - If you are not selected as an instructor in the first two months, you are welcome to continue training with us at a reduced fee rate. Ongoing benefits: - Instructors will continue to receive free martial arts training. - Opportunities to travel to our sister school in Australia Applicants can be current university students, new graduates or mid-career. The successful applicant will be able to provide evidence of working with children and (preferably) martial arts. Overall Purpose and Objective of This Position: The Instructor positions at Paragon Martial Arts are a critical role responsible for maximizing the experience that all students have in class and with our School and ensuring the students learn the curriculum and see positive changes in their lives. This includes teaching class, leading by example and ensuring the space at Paragon Martial Arts reflects the high standards we demand of our School. Roles and Responsibilities: Leading Class – Instructors must be capable of leading a class (you will be trained in all aspects of Martial Arts required). This involves following the curriculum plan and designing and implementing fun and engaging classes that help every student make progress towards their goals. To do this, the Instructor must understand each student's individual goals. Student engagement – The number one role of an instructor is to ensure that every student in a class is actively engaged in the class and that classes are exciting. This should be done through frequent minor adjustments in behaviour through positive means. Every student and person who walks into our School should be made to feel like they are a valued member of our community, of our tight family. You will also be required to run specific drills explained to you by the Instructor. Cleaning – As part of providing our students and families with an experience that surpasses all expectations, it is important that the environment we train in is kept Super clean. Keeping the School clean is the job of every Paragon employee. Leading by example – You must maintain the standard of a superhero both in and outside of karate. You must maintain a minimum of two classes per week of training. You will be asked to hold yourself to a higher standard than others would. Any public social profiles or private ones that have any members of Paragon Martial Arts on them must be maintained at a standard acceptable of someone working with children, for example, no swearing, drunken photos, racist comments or anything demeaning to anyone. Anything that would lower our families' impression of you or the School should be avoided. Student Retention – An essential component of an Instructors role is ensuring all students are continually improving. You will also be involved in helping create a strong relationship between the student and Paragon Martial Arts. You will need to get to know all of our students remembering names is an absolute must. You will also be required to write at least one Great Job card per night of teaching. Sales – As a member of the Paragon Team, it is expected that you will assist with bringing in new students. This may be by referring new students, talking about our programs to people, or helping with getting advertising material out. You will also be required to do basic cash register activities selling uniforms, merchandise and events. You are also expected to interact with Paragon posts through social media and help share the message with your social circle. Expectations: The Instructor is expected at all times to: 1. Lead by example 2. Train minimum two times per week 3. Attend all instructor training sessions 4. Maintain excellent knowledge of the curriculum they have covered. 5. Be punctual on all commitments 6. Conduct themselves with a highly positive, energetic and contagious attitude 7. Be constantly adding value to the student experience 8. Raise the quality of instruction at Paragon Martial Arts 9. Be Punctual to all commitments 10. Maintain a high energy high expectations class. 11. Follow up with the manager or the family on any students missing class 12. Maintain student numbers in class 13. Bring in a minimum of 2 new students per month Characteristics and Skills Sets: 1. Strong and positive attitude 2. Hunger to learn 3. Energetic 4. Martial Arts Interest 5. Ability to interact and talk to children 6. Ability to interact and talk to families 7. Desire to do more than is expected 8. Strong teaching skills with a desire to continually learn how to improve 9. Ability to deliver the curriculum in an exciting manner Reporting Channel: The Instructor reports to the Director of ParagonInc Please apply now if you would like to be considered for the selection process. Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends

Job_Title: Acquisitions Growth Marketing Manager, Small/Medium Businesses Ads - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: The area: Marketing Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself. The role: Acquisitions Growth Marketing Manager, Small/Medium Businesses Ads - Singapore Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the representation of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end. Additional Role Description: The Small and Medium Businesses (SMB) Marketing team is responsible for bringing new advertisers into the Google family of ad products to help advertisers grow their business, reach new audiences, and engage their customer base. We leverage direct marketing channels, innovative alternative channels and sales enablement programs to reach prospective advertisers. We invest in learning about evolving user preference and industry trends, and execute in a - pilot - iterate - scale - approach. Our goals are specific and significant – quantity and quality of new advertisers, supporting Google’s overall growth. You’ll be a growth marketing manager with dual responsibilities of setting up experiments for the web channel to increase conversion rates on Google’s ads homepage as well as a project manager, organizing APAC wide multi-channel experiments based on growth marketing principles. For web experimentation, you'll partner closely with APAC web lead to create test plans, support business casing and measurement. In organizing initiatives, you'll own an initiative tracker and process from business casing, project plan development, launch, significance, and scaling. Responsibilities: - Acquire and grow SMB customers on the web channel to drive acquisitions, and maximize funnel conversion rate optimization. Set up experimentation pilots across APAC, report effectiveness, and recommend improvements. - Set up A/B testing to increase conversion rate including sample size determination, monitor and analyze statistical significance, manage experimentation test plans, and project briefs. - Own initiative tracker and process to manage a large number of initiatives across APAC ranging from media, owned website channel, email/chat, direct scaled acquisitions, and onboarding. - Organize initiatives, keeping track of business casing, project plan development, launch, significance and scaling. Present overviews of initiative status and capacity to wider regional and local stakeholders to maintain visibility and alignment. - Utilize project management systems to manage team's current and backlogged initiatives. Monitor significance of initiatives to flag for scaling or deprecation. Minimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. - 4 years of experience in product marketing, growth marketing, A/B testing, experimentation, user experience, and project management. Preferred qualifications: - Experience in partnering with country marketers in Asia Pacific and global stakeholder teams. - Experience in online advertising, online businesses (e.g., e-commerce, payments, market places etc.), and fast growing businesses. - Understanding of and passion for technology and translating complex issues into simple/intuitive communications. - Ability to navigate fast-moving environment and make the most out of change, moving between detailed work and higher level strategy. - Highly organized with attention to detail, analytical, project, and stakeholder management skills. - Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in English and APAC languages (e.g., Chinese, Korean, etc.) to conduct business by communicating with stakeholders/partners.

Are you looking at teaching PSLE students MORE THAN JUST ACADEMICS? Join us on the mission to provide an education that inspires the Greatness in everyone. Just to give you some understanding of what ISUN stands for… And why PARENTS & STUDENTS all over Singapore came to ISUN for classes? ISUN Education is known to be a powerhouse of committed coaches who are passionate, performance driven and have a strong sense of purpose in education. At ISUN Education, we are known for PSLE Power Revision program. Over the last 13 years, we have personally worked with over 3717 students from both top schools and neighborhood schools, transforming both results and character of the students. We have impacted thousands of lives all over Singapore… by going the extra mile. It’s not just being a TUTOR/TEACHER/TUITION TEACHER. So what is this Academic Coach position all about?? 1. We are hiring 4 coaches who already have a certain skillset. Here’s who we are looking for: PSLE English Coach PSLE Science Coach PSLE Math Coach PSLE Chinese Coach Because ISUN wants coaches who are here to help our students, we are looking for teachers/tutors who are master at their subject and wants to take teaching & class management skills to the next level. Applicants need previous experience in teaching relevant content. 2. We will be working alongside with you during the onboarding training process. Whatever experiences you had in the past are great! WE would love our team to take on new challenges. However at the same time, you must be open to use ISUN strategies which has worked for thousands of students in the past 13 years. How about the ISUN Culture? 1. Building meaningful relationships with parents and students You can say that we are “kay-poh” but that’s because we take ownership and pride in each ISUN warrior’s life. 2. Put the smile back into learning We do crazy fun activities and hold events with the ISUN warriors to reignite the love for learning again. Happy coaches = happy students. 3. Building an excellence mindset We walk the talk. One of the rules for ISUN Warriors is: GIVE your 101%! It applies to us as well in the work that we do. 4. Second home to ISUN students and coaches When you give your best shot in doing what you love, your passion will influence the students and they will just like to stick around the place. (I.E. this is NOT just a JOB, this is a place where you live your purpose and spread the mission with us.) 5. Believing in the GREATNESS in every child Every child has a star in them waiting to be ignited. Every child wants to be the BEST. We believe it is the same for coaches. When you no longer want to be just MEDIOCRE and you are ready to put in the HARD WORK to unleash your own potential, it rubs off to the students. Is this role for you? These are the questions to ask yourself: 1. Are you ready to WALK THE TALK? Each coach gets to build their skills beyond teaching academics. When you grow beyond your comfort zone to achieve your success, your students do. So we need people who are HUNGRY for success and desires to the TOP expert in what they do. 2. Are you ready to PUT IN THE HARD WORK? It is the same as asking our students to gun for A&A*. How many people are willing to put go the extra mile to achieve their own A* goal in life? We need people who are results oriented and we believe in compensation that correlated with results. You are the limit! 3. Are you a team player? This is a second home to many of us – the students, the parents and the coaches. We want a place that is ZERO politics. 3. Are you someone who is goal oriented? It is easy to fall into the trap of spending time in a comfortable way. We need individuals who are self-driven, independent and proactive to hit the goals together as a team. If your answer is YES to all the above, take action now! WANT a chance to be part of the team that transform lives more than just academic results? (only apply if you have passion in teaching & you are a subject master)

JOB PURPOSE: Our goal is to offer a fun, festive and unforgettable experience for every guest. To do this we focus our efforts on making our guests feel welcome, happy and at home, from the moment they walk through the door to the moment we say goodbye. The role of the Service Team Member is to provide our guests with a friendly, professional and enjoyable dining experience. REPORTS TO: Outlet Manager, Duty Manager RESPONSIBLE FOR: Guest Experience KEY OBJECTIVES AND TARGETS Menu Guidance It is important for the Service Team Member to explain the menu to guests and to provide assistance with ordering and making suggestions when required. Service team members must inform guests if they have ordered too much food or if the meal is not balanced, this is done through suggesting alternative dishes. Service team members should also appropriately course the meal and inform guests as per the service training pack. Education & Information Every Loco team member must be passionate about Mexican food and drinks. For this role it is essential that you build a very good understanding of the food and drinks we are serve as well as Mexican culture, and be able to talk about it with guests if asked. You will be given a food and drinks training pack. It is essential that you study this and be ready to make really good recommendations to our guests and to answer any questions they may have. Sequence of Service To ensure we always provide amazing service to our guests, we all need to follow the same basic sequence of service. It is essential that all service team members always follow the service sequence as outlined in the Service Training Pack. This pack will help you learn our standards for welcoming and serving our guests, as well as dealing with sticky situations. Hospitality Customers need to be treated warmly and hospitably at all times. From the first moment a guest walks through the door they need to be attended to with a demeanor that portrays friendliness, comfort and professionalism. This impression needs to be made and then maintained right through their meal and upon their exit. If customers are not made to feel welcome, it is hard to encourage them to return. It is very important to always work with a big friendly happy smile & don’t forget to have fun and engage the guests. Your Tables & The Runners At the briefing prior to every shift, the Duty Manager will assign you to a section with specific tables for you to look after. The Duty Manager will endeavor to ensure that there is no overlap of assigned tables. This is to ensure we provide our guests with the best possible personalized experience and most importantly to minimize confusion. If you do happen to take an order for a table that is not assigned to you, you must inform the section owner immediately. Ideally the food and drinks runners will pass items for your tables to you to hand to your guests. This is to ensure that we provide a professional and informed experience. Occasionally when it is busy and you may be occupied taking an order for another table, the runner, for practical reasons, may drop food directly to the table. Please keep an eye out for this, and remind the runner to keep you informed. It is your responsibility to keep track of ordered and delivered items. Cashier Cashiers are Senior Service Team members who have been given additional responsibilities to settle guest bills. If you are selected to be a Cashier, you will be given formal training and the Cashier SOP by your Outlet Manager. Team Leaders Team leaders are senior service team members who have been given additional responsibilities by the Outlet Manager. Each responsibility will be clearly defined in a SOP, which will be given to you by a manager along with formal training. Managers will also carry out regular checks on these responsibilities to ensure you are not facing any issues. Examples of additional duties may be (but not limited to): stock taking of operational items, flower arrangements, opening set up duties, closing duties, maintenance of specific items. MEASURING PERFORMANCE Customer Requests It is very important to always maintain awareness of your guests and try to continually monitor and anticipate guest needs before they occur. The best way to do this is to continually do the "circuit". Always look up and around for guests in need and most of all be accessible and in view of your guests. Customer Feedback It’s very important to check back on your guests to ensure they are having the best possible experience and so we can identify any issues that we can rectify before its too late. Make sure as soon as you are aware of any issues that you let the manager in charge know. It is also important that you remind the guests to fill out the feedback form at the end of their meal, as it is a great way for us to receive feedback and improve. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1) Always follow the sequence of service as set out in the service training pack. 2) Build product knowledge and be able to recommend good menu choices and answer any questions your guests may have. 3) Opening & closing restaurant as guided by the manager in charge. 4) Cleanliness and tidiness of the restaurant. 5) Always maintain good hygiene practices, tidy appearance and correct uniform at all times. 6) Perform any other tasks or responsibilities to a high standard that have been delegated to you by the Outlet Manager or duty manager in charge.

Our Corporate Advisory team offers our clients assistance in the areas of transaction advisory covering financial due diligence, transaction evaluation and feasibility analysis, deal structuring and negotiation, business and assets valuation and divestiture. Responsibilities: As part of the Transaction Advisory team, working closely with Partners, Directors and Managers, you will have the opportunity to be a vital member in executing projects across three different work streams; valuation, transaction support and M&A advisory. You will: Valuation: • Perform valuation assignments and coordinate the work performed by multiple services lines and regional teams • Undertake financial modelling, financial analysis and market research. • Apply a variety of valuation methodologies for the purposes of enterprise valuation for M&A, litigation support, valuation of intangible assets and intellectual properties, purchase price allocation and goodwill impairment testing. • Coordinate and participate in meetings with target company management and client personnel. • Help growing businesses assess and enhance their valuation. • Manage and respond as appropriate to client needs and assist in developing strong working relationships with clients and intermediaries. Transaction support: • Be a key member in the execution of financial due diligence or other transaction support related assignments. This includes assisting in coordinating the work performed by multiple services lines and regional teams. • Support any business development initiatives covering the preparation of proposals. • Analyse historical financial data and identify operational and key business trends, including identification of key risks and potential deal breaker issues, assessment of quality of earnings and working capital impacting valuation of the target company. • Coordinate and participate in meetings with target company management and client personnel. • Prepare and coordinate the preparation of reports setting out the findings and recommendations on key financial and commercial issues in the transaction. M&A Advisory: • Be a key member to work on M&A advisory projects where we help organisations achieve their strategic plans via acquisitions, divestitures, funding raising etc. • Assist in deal origination through the preparation of relevant materials, including the Information Memorandum. • Perform financial analysis, industry research and build financial models. • Be actively involved in project management throughout the transaction cycle covering preparation of Data Room for potential investors, Q&A management and to facilitate any tasks as necessary for the transaction to completion. • Be work closely with our clients to support them in their negotiations and discussions with potential investors. Job Requirements: • Degree in Accountancy; professional accounting qualifications or finance-related discipline • Minimum 2 years’ related experience, in the areas of financial due diligence or valuation advisory and preferably with foundation in external audit. Those with more experience will be considered for a more senior position. • Technically robust, energetic and culturally adaptable • Strong analytical and report writing skills with the ability to interpret data, generate insights and construct solutions • Strong command of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint • Excellent written, oral and presentation skills. Ability to liaise with Chinese-speaking clients an advantage • Good team player, able to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple deadlines

Job_Title: Demand Planning, Pricing and Sales Analyst
Job_Descriptions: Responsibilites: A) Demand Planning Scope 1. Develop the Demand Plan (In Units and Gross Sales) at multiple levels of aggregation for multiple time horizons (12-18 Months) based on the various predefined inputs from Travel Retail commercial/marketing Team. 2. Coordinates and Collaborates with the Travel Retail Commercial Team through monthly S&OP process to gather, compile and analyze information on sales, marketing activities & NPD launches by also utilizing statistical forecast model for baseline in order to prepare the overall sales forecast. 3. Prepare the Demand Review Deck (Presentation) to facilitate the Demand meeting according to the S&OP calendar and S&OP policies; participate and document the action registers (minute) and provide strict follow up on the established agreements later on. 4. Coordinates and communicate requests for demand changes with global supply planners; Follow up on global stock replenishment plans with supply planners; cts as a liaison between Supply chain and Commercial team to support on demand needs and adjust to plans as necessary. 5. Generate all the outputs from the Demand Reviews in time as part of the S&OP process to integrate with any other local and global process. Final forecast feeds into respective ERP/forecasting system (JDA and SAP) as an aligned number. 6. Assist to lead and complete projects like forecasting tool implementation; S&OP process harmonization etc. 7. Create monthly measurement of forecast accuracy KPI’s, drivers and Action Plans identification and implementation. Prepare, report, and communicate these results to Travel retail team and Regional/Global Demand Planning Team. More importantly to drive how to improve forecast accuracy using KPIs. 8. Activate the regional/global demand planning strategy, principles and priorities within the Travel business. 9. Support commercial team with updates on landing estimates, highlight of stock supply issues, newness incoming availability, sku codes updates etc. 10. Performs other related duties as required. B) Pricing AnalysisScope (Far East Travel Retail) 1. Propose pricings for new innovations or changes to current prices in accordance to global and marketing guidelines, in consideration of industry, market and competitive factors. Submits pricings proposals for relevant approvals from General Manager FETR and Assistant Pricing Manager based in China. 2. Follow through on price uploading in system and distribution of price lists to commercial team for execution. C) Sales Analysis Scope 1. Supports Travel Retail Team on retail sales consolidation, analysis and reports submissions, inclusive of liaising with third party travel retail sales research database holder. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in a business-related or statistics discipline. Must be fluent in English. Must be advanced expertise in Excel and Database Management. Demonstrated proficiency in statistics, strong in Excel and numbers. Ability to independently learn new software applications. Strong problem-solving capabilities and able to analyze and make recommendations. Ability to discern trends and develop recommendations from multiple unrelated data sources. Effective planning and execution skills. Ability to plan while juggling multiple priorities with a proven ability to set goals and prioritize among many important projects. Ability to work independently, meet predetermined and unexpected deadlines. High level of attention to detail and process orientation. Strong written and verbal skills. Able to deliver clear, concise and consistent messages both, up and down, and across the organization. Excellent communication skills including consensus building at all levels. Demonstrated commitment to providing timely feedback. Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment with multi-functional stakeholders and possesses excellent interpersonal skills. Is self-motivated, passionate and a good team player. Experience in a similar role will be an added advantage. Fresh graduates are also welcome.

The CRM team at Wise is growing to consolidate our efforts to develop our APAC communications. What’s the role? As the scale and complexity of Wise products grow, we’re looking for a customer-focused and enthusiastic CRM Executive to join our CRM team in APAC. This is an excellent opportunity to learn, develop your CRM career and work in a customer-focused environment and industry-leading company. You will be responsible for the execution of regional communications for our APAC customers, working closely with the rest of the CRM, Product Marketing, Product, Analytics and Creative teams. CRM at Wise is solving real customer problems and it’s about forming long-term relationships with our customers through best-in-class global and regional communications so our customers use Wise more often for their international money needs, stay with us longer and advocate for us sooner. Our customers love our communications because they’re either entertained, learn something new, or find out about a useful product, service or promotion. So if you have junior - mid level experience and are passionate about driving product adoption and brand awareness, this is the ideal opportunity for you. If you also know a bit about SQL and Braze, then this is an added bonus but by no means compulsory. Your Mission: Own the end-to-end execution of APAC cross-channel marketing campaigns (e.g. product launches and updates, brand awareness, promotions, surveys etc.) using email, push notifications and in-product messages. Working with the APAC CRM manager to manage and implement other projects Manage internal stakeholder communication (Product Marketing Managers, UX Researchers, Designers, Copywriters etc.) Manage and enforce Wise’s communication processes Responsible for email calendar management, deliverability and monthly reporting Implement the localisation process for Wise’s international campaigns Maintain and implement a clear testing plan for all APAC campaigns. Share post-campaign reports and key learnings with the rest of the business. All sorts of other exciting stuff which we would love to talk you through in more detail! About You: You have junior - mid level experience in CRM (1-2 years). You have experience launching campaigns and you know how to engage your audience. You understand CRM basics and possess basic HTML knowledge You have excellent communication skills and strive to have a customer-first mindset You’re analytical and eager to learn and develop You’re a self-starter and impact-driven, with strong attention to detail. You thrive more on autonomy than structure. You’re not afraid to take responsibility and ownership of your work. You come ready equipped with perseverance and a sizeable sense of humour Who we are: Wise was founded in 2011 with a clear mission: Money without borders so people and businesses can send, spend and get paid in any currency, whenever, wherever. Sure, the heart of what we do is international money transfer. And we’re committed to making it instant, convenient and fair for millions of people, all over the world. But we’re growing our other products and our teams at an exciting pace. And we’re looking for the very best to jump on board. What it’s really like to work here: At Wise, we do things a bit differently. There’s no corporate nonsense, and no old-fashioned hierarchy. Instead, we work in dozens of self-sufficient, autonomous teams. Think of them like start-ups within a start-up. Each team picks the problems they want to solve. So, there’s no micro-management. No hiding behind fancy job titles. And no one is telling you what to do. You are your own boss. But you’ll get tons of guidance and plenty of support from your talented, super-smart teammates. We’re going to be upfront — the way we work doesn’t suit everyone. But if freedom, and life-affirming, head-scratching professional challenges rock your world, we could be a match made in heaven. To find out a bit more about what it’s like to work at Wise — plus a full run through of our employee benefits — visit our careers page.

Job_Title: Analytical Consultant, E-Commerce, Large Customer Sales - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: The area: Large Customer Sales (LCS) Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences. The role: Analytical Consultant, E-Commerce, Large Customer Sales - Singapore Being an Analyst at Google is about much more than simply crunching numbers – it’s about finding compelling insights within data and using your exceptional business and communication skills to translate those insights into action. As one of the masterminds behind our strategic planning, forecasting and analysis, you’ll spend your time digging into big, complex data sets. The data will not remain inert in your hands, however, since you’ll use your critical thinking, problem solving and communication skills to influence and drive thoughtful and well-informed decision making with our most senior business leaders within the organization, and potentially some of our biggest clients. Additional Role Description: As an Analytical Consultant within the Large Customer Sales (LCS) team, you will be a core member of Google’s growing business, at the intersection between Strategy, Sales, and Products. You will accelerate business growth for customers and Google by developing strategies and actionable insights that change businesses and transform industries. Additionally, you will work with regional and multinational customers with businesses spanning across Asia Pacific (APAC) markets. By maintaining a deep understanding of the key challenges and opportunities faced by our customers, you will be able to advise them on business, marketing, and media challenges, driving measurable impact. Responsibilities: - Engage and influence internal and external relationships within the client and industry. Build, customize, and deliver solutions through the right forums (e.g., workshops, presentations, etc.) to achieve outcomes. - Develop insights (e.g., qualitative/quantitative) using a variety of internal and external sources. - Serve as an industry expert by developing and creating industry point of views. - Advise clients on methodologies for marketing, media analytics, and measurement. Help customers navigate industry standards and alternatives. - Identify opportunities for clients rooted in effective data rationale. Minimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. - 8 years of relevant experience in technology/start-ups, E-Commerce industry, or consulting. - Experience using SQL to extract and manipulate data, or with other programming or scripting languages (e.g., R, Python). Preferred qualifications: - Experience using Google's measurement suite products, website analytics platforms (e.g., Analytics), and brand analysis techniques. - Experience designing/building scalable and robust data pipelines. - Analytical experience with marketing analytics, return on investment/financial modeling, and statistical analysis. - Ability to pull strategic insights out of large sets of data and manage client relationships.

Job_Title: eTrading Application Production – eCommerce Technical Support Analyst
Job_Descriptions: In Asia Pacific, BNP Paribas is one of the best-positioned international financial institutions with an uninterrupted presence since 1860. Currently with over 18,000 employees* and a presence in 13 markets, BNP Paribas provides corporates, institutional and private investors with product and service solutions tailored to their specific needs. It offers a wide range of financial services covering corporate & institutional banking, wealth management, asset management, insurance, as well as retail banking and consumer financing through strategic partnerships. Worldwide, BNP Paribas has a presence in 68 markets with more than 193,000 employees. It has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. Asia Pacific is a key strategic region for BNP Paribas and it continues to develop its franchise in the region. BNP Paribas offers you an exciting career in an international business environment that is fast-paced, diverse and focuses on creating high-value relationships with our clients. We offer competitive salary and benefits, as well as a working environment where you’re valued as part of the team. * excluding partnerships https://careers.apac.bnpparibas/ Position Purpose This role is a position within the eCommerce Application Production team in Singapore that is part of the global APS e-Solutions group (Application Production & Support), supporting eTrading and eCommerce stakeholders in the region. The team provides technical support and infrastructure management for all front office Electronic Solutions systems, which consist of more than 50 Electronic trading and eCommerce applications hosted on approximately 500 Windows and Linux servers in Asia Pacific and 1000’s worldwide. Team members require a strong understanding of eCommerce systems using a broad range of skills such as Web based technologies, Linux and Windows operating systems and network related such as firewalls, CDNs and load balancers and eCommerce industry standard technologies such as load balancers and proxy servers. Team members are required to liaise with functional application support, development, IT infrastructure teams as well as business stakeholders while managing technical projects, resolving incidents, solving problems and fulfilling requests. The systems that the global team supports are based in in London, New York, Tokyo and Singapore and most of them are live 24/5.5, so close interaction with global counterparts occur on a daily basis. Responsibilities Direct Responsibilities Ownership of Production systems: • Hands on technical support for eCommerce applications, including the BNP flagship eFX Primary dealer web platform for APAC internal users and external clients. • Project delivery for the technical integration of APAC eCommerce applications. • Participate in server refreshes, cloud migrations, DR testing and other initiatives such as Geneos monitoring migration to Dynatrace and the Blade Logic migration to Jenkins. • Work with counterparts in London, Mumbai and New York to provide a follow the sun support model while taking responsibility for the management of incidents and resulting problems that occur in London and New York platforms during Asian hours. • Responsible for ensuring local monitoring, capacity / performance management and automation of local systems as a part of a global framework. • Plan, schedule, implement and document the change activities as well as troubleshooting incidents and resolving problems. • Work with autonomy and independence but within the framework of a global support structure. Contributing Responsibilities • Application integration, technical project management and implementation of the new requirements for eCommerce applications in the APAC region. • Plan, schedule, implement and document the change activities as well as troubleshooting incidents and resolving problems. • Work closely with development teams, business analysts, architects and infrastructure teams to enhance existing platform. eg: resilience, BCP, system performance and low latency. Qualifications Technical & Behavioral Competencies • Good knowledge of web technologies including CDN’s, Apache, IIS, Websphere / Weblogic running on .NET and Java. • Sound understanding of both Windows and Linux server Operating Systems with a particular focus on application implementation and troubleshooting as well as performance tuning. • Good knowledge of TCP/IP networks and firewalls, and multi-tiered security environments. • Ability to architect solutions that integrate eCommerce applications into the existing environment while considering application failover and BCP, performance optimisation, latency and maximising the stability of the platform. • Solid scripting and automation skills required with a DevOps mindset. Python, shell scripting a plus. Specific Qualifications (if required) • Linux, Windows, Cloud, Web technology certifications would be an advantage

Are you looking at teaching PSLE students MORE THAN JUST ACADEMICS? Join us on the mission to provide an education that inspires the Greatness in everyone. Just to give you some understanding of what ISUN stands for… And why PARENTS & STUDENTS all over Singapore came to ISUN for classes? ISUN Education is known to be a powerhouse of committed coaches who are passionate, performance driven and have a strong sense of purpose in education. At ISUN Education, we are known for PSLE Power Revision program. Over the last 13 years, we have personally worked with over 3717 students from both top schools and neighborhood schools, transforming both results and character of the students. We have impacted thousands of lives all over Singapore… by going the extra mile. It’s not just being a TUTOR/TEACHER/TUITION TEACHER. So what is this Academic Coach position all about?? 1. We are hiring 4 coaches who already have a certain skillset. Here’s who we are looking for: PSLE English Coach PSLE Science Coach PSLE Math Coach PSLE Chinese Coach Because ISUN wants coaches who are here to help our students, we are looking for teachers/tutors who are master at their subject and wants to take teaching & class management skills to the next level. Applicants need previous experience in teaching relevant content. 2. We will be working alongside with you during the onboarding training process. Whatever experiences you had in the past are great! WE would love our team to take on new challenges. However at the same time, you must be open to use ISUN strategies which has worked for thousands of students in the past 13 years. How about the ISUN Culture? 1. Building meaningful relationships with parents and students You can say that we are “kay-poh” but that’s because we take ownership and pride in each ISUN warrior’s life. 2. Put the smile back into learning We do crazy fun activities and hold events with the ISUN warriors to reignite the love for learning again. Happy coaches = happy students. 3. Building an excellence mindset We walk the talk. One of the rules for ISUN Warriors is: GIVE your 101%! It applies to us as well in the work that we do. 4. Second home to ISUN students and coaches When you give your best shot in doing what you love, your passion will influence the students and they will just like to stick around the place. (I.E. this is NOT just a JOB, this is a place where you live your purpose and spread the mission with us.) 5.
